Reviews.Title: “Clean but out of city hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraAsh
Reviews.Content: Clean and decent hotel a little out of town. If you are in a group then its no problem but if you are travelling on your own then you might want to check out their shuttle service to the city. Rooms were clean with decent shower and modern bathroom. Amenities were sufficient. Breakfast was good, with plenty to eat and choose from. Capucino machine worth mentioning here for those who love coffee.

Reviews.Title: “School Trip Success”
Reviews.Author: Moochie-La-La
Reviews.Content: Our high school group stayed at the Melia Aurelia Antica from March 31 to April 11, 2012. For European standards, the rooms were a decent size and shower pressure pretty good. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable and the bathrooms pretty modern. The cappucino machine in the lower floor where our group ate breakfast every day was outstanding: best coffee I've ever had. The location of the hotel is nice/quiet because you set back into the hill a bit, away from the constant ambulance and police sirens that you typically hear in Rome, if you have a car, motorbike/scooters or a bus. If you want to have other restaurants/bars within walking distance, this may not be your best bet. The prices in the gift shop are reasonable the owners of the shop were very friendly and sincere. The internet will cost you 7 Euros for 1 hour 20 Euros for 1 day. There are two "stations" in the lobby for internet, so you may experience a line-up if the hotel is near capacity. The windows of the rooms on the bottom floor cannot be opened, so if you like extra ventilation or a breeze at night, ask to be put on the second or higher floor. The pool was not open for us during our stay because the Italians consider it too cold to swim in April. There is a nice exercise room, though. We would return to this hotel for another stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: sarahfru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful, clean, great staff, wonderful little gift shop. I understand staying outside the city center is a challenge and it's not for everyone. You can't just stop by the hotel to change or take a swim, it's too far from the city center. The hotel has a free shuttle, but it's first come first serve and guests jump the line all the time. If there's nowhere to sit you get put out. The last shuttle is at 10pm and if you haven't lined up at 9:30 or you get shoved out of the way by other (adult!) guests, you have to fend for yourself. We took so many cabs home at night that we got very good at figuring out when they were just driving us in circles or taking the long way (we are New Yorkers after all). Sadly I would not stay here again, I'd take convenience over cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: amorimrodrigo
Reviews.Content: Excellente if you are looking for a big, clean and confortable hotel this is the best choice. The shuttle service is very efficient and the staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “make a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Limbers
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in this area, then you could hardly make a better choice. You're a little out of town, so it's quieter and you should be able to get a good rate. But you're only 10 minutes drive from the Vatican. Don't pay more than 40 Euros from Fumicino!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel! relaxing and such a beautiful place to be in the sun!”
Reviews.Author: JJP15
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel in 2010 with a friend of mine and when we arrived our room was not ready so free of charge we were given a upgrade. the room was amazing really big and spacious, bg bathroom looked on to the pool front. there was a nice big coach that acted as the shuttle bus this is the best way to get down to the restaurants and shops as the hotel is on a bit of a hill. when doing tours you are picked up from the hotel so not a big problem. the pool was really nice especially in the amazing hot weather, staff are very friendly, and it is a great place to stay i definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cold have been perfect”
Reviews.Author: gabos1
Reviews.Content: First of all the room was perfect, nice bed very comfortable, everything was clean. The staff was helpful and very welcoming. There is some minor drawback with this hotel, first the mess-up the booking so their system book twice a room with my name and every thing, but after some arguing with the front desk staff I was able to avoid any extra charge. Back then the shuttle system was quite nice, but when the bus was full, well to bad for you, so you had to be quite in advance if you wanna make sure to make it on the bus. The train station is not so far, 10 min walk, so you can easily come from the Termini, airport and to central rome. So except those minor problem I would still recommended this hotel if you want to relax outside Rome, but as other mention you need to be aware that there is no restaurant close by or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mark463
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. Excellent rooms, great restaurant, very comfortable stay. Would definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: KP1Uk
Reviews.Content: Nice room, hotel gave us some treats as it was our anniversary..nice touch. Courtesy bus very handy, although up on Sunday ready for 8am bus,only for no driver to be present. Receptionist just shrugged and was not interested. A group of about 12 people waited until about 9.30 when driver wandered up with no explanation. Appreciate it is a free bus but a helpful response from reception would have been nice! We almost missed our visit to the Vatican. Overall good hotel, good facilities even though it is out of the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: pepca
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's not in the centre, so make sure you use the shuttle to start exploring Rome in the morning and return late, having spent the day exploring and eating in Rome. The food here wasn't too tasty. The rooms are great, there is plenty of common space and two pool tables. The shuttle was as scheduled, although the walk from the centre to the Vatican station (just behind the vatican museums) takes a while.

Reviews.Title: “Outside of the City Center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: dkitchen794
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outside of the city center of Rome-way out. There is nothing at all around this hotel to walk to or to see. The hotel itself is very nice, clean and modern. The bar however cannot make mixed drinks too well-best to stick to wine, beer or straight up. The staff seemed to be nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value money for business stay”
Reviews.Author: Roccoandhisbrothers
Reviews.Content: Good hotel services and nice location in the middle of a green park, quite, but little beat far from down town or business area at EUR zone; limited access to public transportation; that's really nice if you have a car. Room are quite large even "single", lobby flooor is open, no queue for check-in and check-out, people are friendly (not in the resturant) and there is planty of facility, like outdoor pool, garden with dehor, gym, sauna, congress centre, few shops, great overlooking from resturant terrace. Food is typical from hotel resturant, overall is on average and great breakfast choice in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle and Service Better This Time”
Reviews.Author: Moltrasio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of September. By European standards (Italy), the hotel is a four star, by American Standards, perhaps a 3.5. We had stayed here once before and had issues with the shuttle but this time it was much improved, as was the hotel reception service. We found this hotel very good because we had a car but did not want to drive in downtown Rome. It was nice to leave the car for three nights and take the free hotel shuttle back and forth. It drops you off quite near the Vatican and many of the major sites are within walking distance. The hotel and room were clean and had most of the conveniences of North American hotels. As other reviews indicate, the hotel is quite far out and there isn't much around the area. We didn't mind as we spent all day and evening in Rome city where we also ate at a much more reasonable cost. We booked this hotel through Expedia far in advance and got a really good rate compared to the hotel site and later on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: 3-fl-oz-com
Reviews.Content: The staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. The location is remote. The gym is antiquated. The food is not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But too Far from City of Rome”
Reviews.Author: rubydee11
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel, nice attention to guests; However, too far away from city. They do have a shuttle, but it does make your stay too structured. Taxis one way are at least 20 euro. Also restaurant was okay, but being so far away from other restaurants, after three days you get tired of the same food. Maybe if they vary the menu each couple of days, it would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “cheating tourists, pool closed, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Marculino_Reb
Reviews.Content: my wife & me staying from 6 to 9 Sep 2011 in this terrible hotel. Slide show at reception and website showing nice pool, which should be opened from April to Sept-30. But from end of August swimming pool is closed. We booked (& paid) Superior Room (website: all with own balkony), but we had poor standard room without balkony. Medium beer costs 9 EUR, was a pitty. Very large distance to Rome center & with 28 degrees celsium without pool very sad. Also taxi drivers cheating us from/to airport. Only to/from city taxis charged regular prices. Last time Melia for long, long time - so sad! Marc & Wife

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Bold40
Reviews.Content: Unusually I booked this hotel on a personal recommendation and didn;t check the Tripadvisor reviews, If I had I probably would not have booked but I think this would have been a shame. Taking a 3 day break in Rome with our 3 daughters I wanted a hotel which was reasonable in terms of cost but also had a swimming pool (when taking children to a city a pool to retreat to mid afternoon is a god-send.) This hotel proved a base for a very good trip. However, as can be seen from some of the other reviews the hotel is by no means perfect although some of the criticisms described elsewhere did not match my experience. Positives:- * the receptionist team were always cheerful, helpful and excellent * rooms were of good size, clean and well maintained * the restaurant food was generally good - yes quite expensive but nothing out of the ordinary in an Italian hotel from my experience * reliable shuttle bus which only took 20 mins to get into the centre of Rome (but there was no traffic on the roads in the middle of August) * the pool is an excellent facility Negatives * All staff not quite so attentive - at breakfast staff had a remarkable ability to avoid eye contact * The bar lacks atmosphere and whilst it is supposed to open at 7pm it was opened at 7.30ish by someone who seemed to be a bit frustrated that a few residents might want a drink * I was prepared for the distance from central Rome - however the fact that the hotel really is in the middle of no-where (general scrubland / a few residential houses) meant that you couldn;t walk out to a local shop or bar. Would I stay again? Probably not although, as i said, the hotel ticked the key boxes I really enjoyed Rome and would probably leave the kids at home next time and take my wife to a more Central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: TeamBN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Rome city break and we were pleased with the room and its cleanliness and we loved the fact we could take a swim after a long day walking around Rome, the hotel offers a shuttle bus service in and out of Rome and this is really useful. However I would not recommend eating in the restaurant as this is very overpriced and the quality is not what you would expect from Italian cuisine. I would also be prepared to find the most convenient supermarket in Rome, they are few and far between but offer the most value for money when buying water and drinks. Water in a supermarket is around 1-2 euros but from a shop or vendor in Rome you can pay up to 9 euros!!! The beer prices range from 7 - 10 euros and this compared to a small coke at 7 euros!!?!?! The hotel charges similar prices. The staff are helpful and polite, we never had no issues with the room, we were just simply unprepared for the expensive drinks and food! Everyone try's to rip you off and it simply spoils what a beautiful city Rome is. By all means GO but go prepared, no the prices before you set foot in anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, being a bit far from the city gave us a great rest after very busy days.”
Reviews.Author: Amancay58
Reviews.Content: This very comfortable and quiet hotel in the outskirts of Rome was very relaxing and a good place to rest after our hard walking days in Rome. There is a very convenient shuttle into and back to the city, last one back at around 8.30 p.m. which gets you back to dine and sleep early. Excellent breakfast and dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out!”
Reviews.Author: Pat09
Reviews.Content: I joined an American friend who already had a confirmed booking in the hotel. I suspected it was too far from the city centre - and it certainly was. The hotel shuttle was excellent, the staff helpful and the room well maintained. BUT once in the hotel we were stuck - restaurant ok but limited, and there was no ambiance, mainly other guests were business people, or groups with their own coach who were only seen as they set off in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a beautiful city, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: lauraJpantry
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night trip to Rome, first time in this beautiful city. Booked through lastminute.com and chose the secret hotel option. The hotel is as described, clean, large rooms and spacious hotel. As we spent majority of the time in the city centre we need not try any of the food - particularly as v expensive! The hotel is approx 20 min drive from the Vatican city however in rush hour this journey took almost an hour.The free shuttlebus is excellent, always prompt and running reguarly from 8am til 10pm. Shame the last bus was 10pm but that is the only fault. The hotel itself was around 25 mins taxi drive from the airport, cost us 40 euros each way. We did two half day tours of Rome with Viatours - v good comapny would highly recommend. We did the Vatican and Enjoy Rome tours and the guides were v knowledgable. Only downpoints to hotel were no tea and coffee facilities in room which is crazy to me, expensive food/drink and next time I visit Rome would stay somewhere more central but overall a great short stay and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Friendly Staff - But there is NO FREE airport transfer”
Reviews.Author: RKVB
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee' and I spent a fantastic busy weekend in Rome with the intention of seeing as much of ancient Rome and the Vatican City as possible in 3 days. A tall order as there is so much to see and not all of it is possible in such a short space as time. We were lucky enough to witness the Pope deliver mass during Palm Sunday and St. Peters Square is remarkable as is the Basilica. The Hotel we satayed in, Melia Roma Aurelia Antica, was an excellent clean and very friendly hotel. The food was excellent and staff were very helpful and spoke good English. The only disapointing part was on our arrival; the package deal from the hotel included a free transfer from the airport to the hotel. This never happened and on ringing the hotel they said they did not provide this service and I should get a taxi. This cost me 45 euros. This is very misleading and the hotel do not run this transfer service. That said I would definately return to the hotel and use the coach service to Rome (5 euros) and then use the metro (1 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Bad location”
Reviews.Author: d1n1k4
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with this hotel only bad location, the shuttle bus is the best service from the hotel, always on time. Considering we have been to rome before and stay in the heart of city, the location is really bothering me. The stuff was helpful and the breakfast was ok, but the wifi is not free, it cost 5 Euro only for 15 minutes surfing. There's a "reasonable price store" inside the hotel if you want to buy some souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Good building spoiled by horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Geerlings
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a bit outside the site, but it is walking distance from a subway station. The building and rooms are nice, but the staff.... The cook could not cook, the pasta was very much al dente (not cooked), the risotoo was wet with cruncht rice (not cooked long enough) and the meat was overcooked and burned. We ate with a group of about 100 people and about 75% of the meals went back. When I complained about the speed of the paid internet (it took 20 minutes to download an 8Mb file), they said they can not take responsability becasue they buy it from a third party. Even complaining the the management did not help. I was lucky, some of my colleagues could not even connect. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE !!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Canterbury2010
Reviews.Content: Firstly from the airport to the hotel is quite expensive - it was about 80 euros for 6 of us and the journey is about 40 minute drive. It is a very secluded area which did mean you could have a great nights sleep, however there were no nice views to look at from your bedroom window. The rooms were nice and big, with a good shower. The cleaners did a great job - they would fold all our clothes up as well as do normal duties like changing bed sheets. Free shower gel etc was provided. The staff on the front desk and in the restaurant were awful, they were really rude and asking for help always seemed like an inconvenience. To be fair the receptionist did book us a taxi for our return journey to the airport - although again this seemed to be a hassle for them. Food in the restaurant was pretty bad, you could pay 9 euros for the basic breakfast or 19 euros for the full selection however we just paid for the 9 euro one as no one checked what you ate. Waitresses seemed pretty stroppy and were in no hurry to help. The free shuttle bus was a life saver, the journey would take about an hour each day but that was due to the general masses of traffic in Rome. A note on the roads: they are insane - when we asked a taxi driver (who cost about 25 euros to get from the city centre to the hotel) if they had rules on the road he replied with "well, red lights are suggestive", there were no road markings so if you got in the way you would be rammed off the road. We were very glad we didn't hire a car to drive. But we used the shuttle bus to go into Rome and back to the hotel twice a day and its only problem was the time taken to get to Rome. The pool wasn't open when we stayed .... that wasn't stated anywhere ..... so it was a bit annoying as the weather was beautiful in september and it would of been a great way to spend an afternoon. As someone in a previous review of this hotel has said, it was quite geared towards business meetings rather than tourists. So overall it was okay but the rudeness of the staff let it down massively. Highly doubt we'll ever go back there

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet...”
Reviews.Author: Checkitout520
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outside of Rome, close to Vatican City. Hospitality is great. The room is good size and very clean. The only drawback is to get to the shuttle location before 10:00 PM at night. Otherwise, taxi trip is expensive and route is dark.

Reviews.Title: “Out Of The Way Luxury”
Reviews.Author: cow_manx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far from the city and when seeing the sights this doesn't matter care of their shuttle however from the airport you're in for an expensive cab ride. Another note about the shuttle - they have a strict no smoking policy but the driver smokes! The rooms are beautiful and large with high ceilings. The restaurant is somewhat expensive and serves food not geared towards North American tastes. They shut down the pool at the end of August which doesn't seem to make much sense given the warm Roman Septembers. They have a couple gift shops which are pretty good however they keep some strange hours.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rooms, stupidly inconvenient location, overpriced food. Awful!”
Reviews.Author: fun_city_gal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting and I want to warn anyone with allergies to dust mites to AVOID THIS DUMP at all costs. We had three pre-paid nights booked b/c we were part of a wedding group, but left after one awful, sneezy, nose-rubbing night. I woke with an awful headache and had to get out of there. I will have to fight with a "travel agent" at TripDucky after we return home to get my money back. The hotel lobby has been renovated and is modern looking, though tacky. It is a facade. The rooms and hallways have disgusting old carpet that is literally threadbare. My chair seat and bedspread had gross stains on them. The room smelled musty and dusty on entry. I complained about the dust and dirtyness of the room to the front desk right away, and they supposedly cleaned while we were at a very expensive dinner in their restaurant (there is nowhere else to go). Upon return, though, my room still smelled of dust. They didn't change the pillow cases as I had asked them to do, and the stained bedspread had been put back on the bed. The dinner was very expensive - 14 Euros for an average plate of spaghetti. My Dad's "spicy pasta," which turned out to be a fish stock dish, was inedible; it was extremely salty and fishy. There were only three waiters who were rushing around, avoiding our eyes so we could not request help. They never once checked on us. We finally flagged down another waiter and told him to take the offending meal off the bill, and bring us the darn bill so we could get out of there. An awful first night in Rome. One HUGE problem - do not discount this - is this hotel's really INCONVENIENT location FAR outside of central Rome, which is why it's cheap. I gasped in horror as we approached this hotel at the top of a hill in the middle of nowhere, hoping it wasn't really our hotel. There is a hotel bus that goes back and forth to/from the city of Rome, about 15 miles away (my estimate - we never took the bus), but people were complaining it was never on time. We paid 30 Euros the next morning to get us to another hotel in the heart of Rome arranged by my WONDERFUL travel agent, John Clifford (John@InternationalTravelManagement.com). Other problems: My parents' safe wouldn't work; their room near the elevator was extremely noisy - you could really hear people talking out by the elevator and in the rooms on either side; my internet access wouldn't work (they sent up 2 men with terrible body odor who couldn't fix it, then sent the front desk attendant who did). My internet connection was very slow. I think it was 12 Euros for a 24 hour period. There was no water available to buy in the hotel "store"; the bar charged 3 Euros one time to buy a bottle, and 4 Euros the following morning on our way out. I asked the Melia hotel manager to arrange for a taxi to get us out of there and to our next hotel, but of course she refused. She wanted me to sit down with her and explain why I thought our rooms were dirty. Please! As if I hadn't been inconvenienced enough. It is so much better to find a small clean hotel in the center of Rome to stay. The Metro is terrific and easy to navigate, but I like best the hop on/hop off buses that circle Rome and drop you off at all the major sights. Have a wonderful trip in Rome....just don't stay at the awful Melia! Lesa in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Not bad BUT ......”
Reviews.Author: dabberdabberdo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, staff fairly friendly but the reception staff were very 'commercial' rather than being 'personal'. Upon arrival at just gone 12.00pm, we checked in and were offered the opportunity to include breakfast (which was not part of our booking) as well as upgrading to a superior room for and all for an extra 30 euros per night. When told "no thank you", we were told the room was not available until after 2.00pm, however the superior room was available stgraight away. When finally checked into the room, I was mortified to learn that they do not offer an iron in the room but they do offer a laundry service which of course you have to pay for. This was quite expensive. Instead, I went and purchased an iron from a shop in the Vatican City for 14 euros which was much less expensive than paying for the hotel to press my clothes. The hotel has a resturant which we didn't use (very pricey) and they also have a bar where you can purchase snacks like burger and chips, pizza etc but again, prices are high. There was no tea or coffee facility within the room and the TV only has 5 channels and luckily one of these was BBC worldwide. The walls were thin as you could hear people in the shower next door! Internet was available but for a price. Shop on site but again, expensive (8 euros for a fridge magnet). Shuttle bus to the Vatican City was handy as otherwise you would be stuck but this also meant either eating at the hotel in the evening or staying out all day to eat in the city before returning to the hotel. At times, the bus was very busy but we had no problem in getting a seat. On a positive note - the cleaners were very good and even folded my pyjarma top! Overall - hotel was ok but for the price paid, I expected more. It felt like they would charge for anything - I did check that weren't charged for the toilet rolls! The hotel is also a conference centre and so is used by people on business which is what it felt like the hotel was more aimed at. Remember - take your own iron (and adaptor).

Reviews.Title: “An excellent way to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: olson182
Reviews.Content: The Melia Rome Aurelia Antica hotel was a fantastic choice for me and my girlfriend to see Rome. The rooms are very good, it was a clean hotel, the restaurant served some excellent food with very good service, and the pool is lovely. We had trouble finding the hotel, which was down to the poor directions found on Lastminute.com. If you are arriving by train, get the metro to Degli Ubaldi metro stop, not Valle Aurelia. Then it is the bus stop just slightly down the hill with 892. We were told the wrong station, and spent hours looking for the right bus stop which didn't exist! The shuttle is an excellent addition to the hotel, and we used it plenty of times. it drops you right outside the Vatican walls, and just one street from the Ottoviana metro station. The only downside to the shuttle, was the fact it is one coach, and on several occassions people were turned away as it was full (this happened to us on our last day sadly.) Overall I would definately recommend this hotel, and my advice would be to try the restaurant and pool as they are brilliant. Just make sure you research all your travel info before leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Easy going city break sorted”
Reviews.Author: good_review34343
Reviews.Content: for travellers who are looking for somewhere comfortable, clean and friendly to stay it ticks all the boxes. We did not stay in the hotel during the day. Breakfast was more than expected, with the MAS rewards card it was 2 for 1, great value for the quantity. Our only reservations about this particular hotel is the bed was very hard and the walls were barely sound proof! Staff were extremely helpful. Note for female travellers from the UK and Ireland with powerful hair driers...the hotel cannot hack the power, I shut the power down on the whole floor from just drying my hair! Shuttle bus was a great facility, although the last bus was at 22:00 a taxi from the Vatican will cost approx 20 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably nice hotel, appalling service”
Reviews.Author: Glostripper27
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews and high approval rating on Expedia booked at this hotel for city break. Staff on arrival were not very welcoming although room was reading at 1330. The room was very large by normal standards but showing its age as carpet needed replacing, but was spotlessly clean. However very annoying that maid rearranged room how she wanted it to be. On the last two nights had a German teenage tour party who proceeded to run along the corridors, shout and bang doors until the early hours and despite phoning reception were not that keen to deal with issue. Would echo many travellers concerns with shuttle bus - more needed in morning (earlier start than 0800) and evening, not so many in day, although 892 bus from Baldo Metro station was very reliable. Walk from Aurelia station was 20-25 minutes uphill. Poor choice of TV stations in English - only 5 news channels. Declined breakfast due to high cost of E16.50

Reviews.Title: “It urgently needs a big renovation!”
Reviews.Author: ninamarta
Reviews.Content: In the middle of nowhere this is a badly decorated hotel that seem to be stuck in the early 90’s with its green old carpet floor and bad wood furniture. If you’re into gold details you’ll love this hotel! Here you see gold everywhere! For me it was a bad night in a bad mattress in a horrible room! And in the morning the noisy cleaning staff woke me up… There is a poor selections of TV channels if you don’t understand Italian and the breakfast in room was way too simple and for the price, the eggs from the American Breakfast should arrive hot. Because the service took forever (like if they where lost) and I got my breakfast 10 minutes after schedule I ended dialing room service and asking them for my breakfast. On the other end of the line there was an Italian who barely spoke English! Front desk was very quick and polite with check-in and out. This is the only reason why I give t a 2 star review instead of 1!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. Debbie Portsmouth”
Reviews.Author: debbieportsmouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights from 8th July and found it to be a positive experience.Our son had stayed at the hotel at Easter and recommended it to us, and we are glad we took his advice. Beautiful, clean room, friendly, helpful staff, fantastic breakfast. Only downside to us was the very high prices of food and drink at the pool bar. 9euros for not even half a pint of beer.Excessive even compared to the rest of Rome.This was remedied by following others example of bringing food and drink back with you from your day out.Overall a positive experience and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Great Price - Good Shuttle - Horrible Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CanadaAaron
Reviews.Content: The Great: - Staff at the front desk - Price - View from the rooms - large green space, rolling hills - Room quality / cleanliness The Good: - Shuttle service was adequate - always room on the bus, but they could run more frequently and later. - About a 45 Euro taxi fare from the Airport The Bad: - The restaurant - It was expensive, bland, not busy, and had mediocre service - The traffic on the 8am shuttle bus during weekday traffic - No other choices except for the restaurant at the hotel when at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Far From City”
Reviews.Author: Kula762
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights with a tour group. The hotel was very nice, the staff were attentive, the rooms were new and clean. They have a nice little gift shop with all the usualy touristy things that you may have opted not to buy while you were out shopping. The only knock against this hotel was that it is FAR from anything. Not walking distance far either... After our tour ended we moved to the Ambasciatori Palace in central Rome, which cost only about 25 euros or so to get there by taxi. If you are visiting all the Roman tourist spots, taking a cab to the city every day may get expensive.

Reviews.Title: “expensive, but good”
Reviews.Author: debbieUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days before going on a cruise. We wanted a place with a pool so our 13-yr-old would have something to do after touring all day, every day. We arrived and our room was not ready, but they offered us an "upgrade" for and additional 29 Euros a night, we were exhausted, hot and said okay. The room was very nice, the linens were beautiful and it was very comfortable. The first 2 days we got back to the hotel late and didn't use the pool but decided on our last day to stay at the hotel and relax. Well, there were 2 conventions staying here and the pool was closed and the pool bar and restaurant would not be open in the evening bc there was a private party. The inside bar was also closed, so we basically sat in our room and watched TV - not what I paid 230 Euros a night for. My son was pretty disappointed. I also sent out 2 small bags of laundry and the bill was 155 Euros! The clothes weren't worth that much! We ate at the pool restaurant twice and it was very good "bar" food, but way overpriced. We found the shuttle to be great! It was always there on schedule and there were plenty of seats. I would recommend this hotel, but be prepared for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value for money- location is no problem”
Reviews.Author: King_Resh
Reviews.Content: The Melia Aurelia is incredible value for money. Great service, excellent quality rooms all for an amazing price. My wife and I stayed here for a week in mid may and were throughly satisfied with our experience, in fact, as it happened, we were upgraded to a superior room at no charge on one occasion. At the end of a tiring day in Rome, you dont want to come back to a dark, dank dingy hotel with substandard accomondation, and at the Melia, you can rest assured you wont. To address the issue of location, which is a natural one that people keep bringing up, we caught the shuttle bus a total of 9 times, missed the bus once (8:30pm), and had one occasion where we were the last 2 people on (10 am). A taxi from Ottaviano to the hotel set us back 13 euro, and one to the nearest metro from the hotel, maybe 10euro. In our book, shelling out 13Euro once out of 10 trips was well worth it. Quite a crush on one of our morning trips though, a lot of shoving and people jockeying for best position, we had one character who held down the entire back row...Melia management cant be blamed if fheir guests are total cretins I guess. Another inconvience that goes along with this is that catching the shuttle means dinner in Ottaviano as there is not much near the hotel (minor inconvenience, there are a couple of places in Ottaviano that were great, look for the guy who has the newspaper article outside his restartaraunt talking about his restaraut in LA). Melia management- You should implement some type of a first come, first served ticket system from the hotel to ensure those lining up first are not forced out, which I observed happened on a few occasions. Also at peak periods (8am-10am), (8:30pm-10:30pm), consider 1 bus every 45 mins, and a bus every 2 hours outside these times- thats when your peak load is! In summary, great hotel, excellent service, terrific rooms. Location + accompanying issues with shuttle bus will not be enough to keep us from coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-could not fault!”
Reviews.Author: Davethebunny
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this hotel, for the price it was excellent, the location may be out of the centre however we regularly got the shuttle bus and it only took 15-20 minutes and left you right by metro stop Ottaviano. Breakfast is expensive but sign up on their website before hand for the MAS rewards programme and you get 2 breakfasts for the price of 1...excellent value. Pool bar is nice but expensive however in comparison to eating around Piazza navona and the Pantheon is similar in price (12 euros for a cocktail!). I would recommend going to a local store in Rome centre and buying alcohol from there if you are really bothered about having a drink. We used the Terrorvision bus service to get to Ciampino airport, brilliant value at 8 euro return and we simply got the metro from Ottaviano on the Red Metro line direct to Termini to catch this service. Prior to our departure we emailed the hotel to request that we could catch the shuttle bus in order to check in and the response was very fast and included a copy of the shuttle bus timetable which we thought was brilliant. The bus waits outside the Metro bar cafe and on our last night we used the last service at 10pm which was there on time. I would only recommend that you are there 10 mins prior to departure as the bus leaves promptly. We also used the local bus service 892 which stops outside the hotel every 13 mins, for 1 euro you can get to the closest metro stop and your ticket is valid on the metro for 75mins! Hotel overall a fantastic purchase and will definatley return.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away”
Reviews.Author: wildlphn
Reviews.Content: staff nice, room was clean, a bit uncomfortable. good size for rome. Location was terrible, had to take a shuttle into Rome, which lets you off within walking distance of the Vatican and right next to the Metro, but you have to pay over 40 Euros to get to the hotel from the airport and the same amount or more to get back to the airport. Didnt try the restaurant, and no place to eat outside of the hotel. Its a good 45 mins into Rome on the shuttle and they were late in picking you up a few times. Internet expensive, 7 euros for an hr or 12 euros for 24 hrs. I think they should have offered free wifi..this was not a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: normxray
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, well worth the money we paid. Rooms very clean, staff friendly and spoke good english, buffet breakfast excellent. Definitely a 4* bordering on 5* hotel. Shuttle bus reliable and convenient. Minor complaint that one time the bus back from Rome was full so we had to wait for the next one, however considering the difference in price between this hotel and a central rome hotel, there really was nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Irynaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Melia for 4 nights in May on business. We knew that hotel is away from city center and provides shuttle bus. It was disadvantage, but we decided to stay there as normally when we stay at Melia in London we get good rooms and friendly service. Well, rooms were spacious and clean and we had a big choice for breakfast. This part was as we expected. Hugh disappointment was restaurant. We had our dinner there at first evening and never wanted to come back. Food is average, prices are high, but service was really bad. Waiter who was taking our order turned his back to my colleague when he was talking and started chatting to the other waiter over the restaurant. We did not complain just to not spoil evening. Interesting thing about front desk: if you succeed in attracting their attention, staff is nice and helpful. The trick is to make an eye contact when you are waiting, you just wait and they are busy doing something, not paying any attention to you. It never works if you are just quietly waiting by the desk, Why is that? Is it special training for Melia staff in Rome not to pay attention to customer?

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as all that”
Reviews.Author: EnglishAshman
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for 3 nights for visting Rome before heading elsewhere in Italy. We were somewhat concerned after reading some of the reviews on here, especially the shuttle bus. I can however say that we found the hotel was fine and the shuttle bus was never even half full on each trip in and out of town. It did frequently get stuck in traffic and its clear that Italians genetically cannot drive but the longest in took was half an hour. No big problem. It is out in the middle of no where but hence the price. Staff were friendly and only criticism would be the ridiculously soft bed. Ouch my back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from Rome”
Reviews.Author: trvelgurl09
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our time at Melia Roma but we may have paid a little bit more to stay closer to Rome or within walking distance of a Metro line. The hotel shuttle was great as we didn't have any trouble getting on, but based on the lines at Rome's top sites, I suspect this was not a busy time for the hotel. We were there in the middle of May. The shuttle is a coach bus that is about a 15 minute ride to the Metro Ottaviano stop in Vatican City. The shuttle runs about every 90 minutes or so depending on the time of day. When we missed the shuttle we paid about 10 euro to get to the nearest Metro stop, which was Cornelia on the red line. That area also has plenty of restaurants and an internet hub. The hotel itself was clean and roomy. Be prepared that if you arrive in the morning, your hotel room may not be ready. We missed the shuttle to Rome and ended up waiting in the lobby for about an hour and a half before we got our room. The breakfast is pricey, but if you sign up for the free Mas rewards program before you arrive you get buy one get one free breakfast. The food is fine and a nice option, especially when paying 12 euro for breakfast is like 6 each with the mas rewards program. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and pleasant. If you are looking for a place that is centrally located this isn't the place for you. There are minimal side walks and the road outside the hotel is busy on the way to the main road. By the time you factor in cab rides, you may have been better off to stay closer to the city. But if you're looking for a clean, roomy and comfortable hotel, this is the place for you. My only complaint was that the basic room beds were very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: HelenRetford
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, the hotel was superb and the staff very friendly. The bus service was very useful but arrive early! We found a really good restaurant only a 8 euro taxi ride away. Joseph Roma Via Accursio 12 Piazza Irnerio t. 06 6623887 really good food, fabulous grills, pizzas and pasta at very reasonable prices, a local restaurant for local people, but we were made very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from the center, but pretty decent choice!”
Reviews.Author: cmcs13
Reviews.Content: I cannot tell you about the value, for I had a voucher for the Hotel. But I can tell you that the service is pretty good. The breakfast buffee is very good and the rooms are very clean and confortable. The hotel is not in the city center, is actually a bit isolated in a business area. They do have a bus that services Vatican city and back from 8am to 10pm, for free. You could be in for some traffic and take at least 30 min to get to the center. There's also another option (besides the obvious taxi), there's a bus that takes you to the closest subway stop, and then the subway to town (the subway is very easy to use, only 2 lines and tickects are 1EUR for 75 min). If you have children is probably not the best option, but if you wanna stay way from the busy center is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bobilina
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews I started to stress about getting to and from the airport. I was about to book a cab online but decided against it as it could have been dodgy. We got a taxi from outside the airport and it only cost 40 euros. This was from FCO, the other main airport would have cost 30 euros. This is a set price for the white taxis (their version of black cabs) so it also cost exactly 40 euros to get back to the airport. The reception were happy to call a cab for us and it came in just 4 minutes. The room was lovely - spacious and very clean. Nice and quiet but I found the bed quite hard which ruined my sleep a bit. The shuttle bus service was fine, we had no problems with space on there at all. Got on at all sorts of times, including first and last buses, plenty of space when everyone waiting got on. I would definately go back to this hotel as it was cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But know what you are getting in to”
Reviews.Author: theevrards
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel, but you have to know what you are getting into. Me, and my wife took this trip to celebrate our last piece of freedom as we are expecting our first child in 4 months, so we were not really looking for night life, or staying out late, and after reading many of the reviews on TA decided to give this hotel a try. Pros: Breakfast package: We got the breakfast package with our room, this allowed us to get breakfast before we headed into the city, this added a convenience, as we did not have to worry about finding food before heading out, and since the hotel is out in the middle of no where you will not have any other options. The breakfast was decent, and provided everything me and my wife needed, meat, fruits, toast, coffee, juice, water, etc. We would occasionally take a banana or two back into the room, for a snack. If you do not get the breakfast package, its 16 Euros per person, which is a total rip-off, and definitely not worth it. Room: For a European Hotel, the Rooms are large, spacious, clean. When we looked out our window on the 4th floor we saw sheep grazing, and a lot of open space. Hence, at night it was very easy to sleep, or go out for a stroll (While avoiding all the smokers standing in the front) Shuttle: For us the shuttle worked great. We timed the shuttle accordingly and did not have to worry about much. There are both positive and negative sides to the shuttle, but for the time being I will focus on the positives. The day we decided to visit the Vatican, the shuttle worked perfect, we got off ottaviano, and just walked 10 minutes to the vatican. Things to be Aware of: Getting there the first time: Getting to the Hotel the first time, can be the biggest hassle, especially if it is your first time in ITaly. If you are flying into FCO, this is the information we hope someone would have given to us. To get to the Hotel, email them ahead of time and ask them for the time the Shuttle picks up from the city center. When you fly in pay for the Leonardo Express tickets from the Airport right now its (14E per person) make sure you validate it, or you will be charged a penalty of 50 Euros on the train, trust me, we've seen it happen and it will ruin your trip. You can also get your return tix to FCO at that time, just don't validate it. Only validate the ticket you are using to get you to the city at the machine, and when you are on your way back validate the other. Its cheaper to buy it at the airport, than at termini, 2 euros cheaper per couple. The train leaves every 15 minutes. Take the Leonard Express to Termini, and then take line A to Ottaviano, which is an additional 1 Euro. When you get to Ottaviano you want to be in front of this little store called MetroBar. There you can wait for the Shuttle. It is a large Coach Bus, with the name of the Hotel on it. That is the cheapest and easiest way. Note: The shuttle is not exact, and can be +/- 10 minutes based on traffic. Hotel Restaurant: The Hotel Restaurant is extremely expensive, and for sub-par food. Recommendation, before you return to the Hotel, there are markets at Termini Station, and around Ottaviano, buy some bread, wine, cooked meats (whole fryers), and food, and take it back with you, it will cost less than 10 euros, and will feed at least two people for the night. Packaged Breakfast: As mentioned above, I had the packaged breakfast, most of the days we stayed there we would go down around 930 to breakfast, and it was great, few people fresh food, however the day we were leaving, we went down at 7AM and realized its a big no, no at that time, thats when all the tour groups, and conferences, etc are down there, and it is a mad rush, they run out of food, and you have to wait in line, etc. If you wait till the crowds leave around 830 and moving forward, you can eat breakfast in peace, with no wait on anything, and still manage to take the shuttle to Ottaviano, headache free. Internet: The mother of all rip-offs, they will charge you, 12e in your room for a 24 hour period. if you are doing basic emails you can go to the lobby and pay 2e for each 15 minutes. still a rip, but when you are out there, and you don't have any other option you use it. My recommendation, setup skype on your computer, and call the US for free on the internet, makes you feel a little bit better about 12 Euros a day. on the good news, there is free printing downstairs, so if you pay the 2 euros for the 15 minutes you can easily check in for your flight and print your boarding pass. which is completely worth it. Television: If youre like us, and will be back in the room by 20:30 and looking for something to kill time like watching TV, forget it. There is absolutely nothing on except CNN, BCC, and a couple of other news channels, and thats it, everything else you have to pay. Shuttle: The bad thing about the shuttle is it ends relatively early, and if the hotel is busy the last shuttle is a free for all. for us we were home by 20:30 and so it was a non-issue. but if you do want to come home later, your cheapest route, will be take a cab from Cornelia metro stop, where you would normally take the 892 bus, and it will cost you 15e to get back to the hotel. In conclusion: There are definitely some limitations with this Hotel based on its location, however for what we were looking to do, and our circumstance, it was perfect. I would love to see the internet rate cheaper, but its a sellers market when it comes to internet where they are located. If I came back to Rome, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Somewhat Posh Hotel Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: MKB1701
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based upon my positive experience in Melia Berlin and the fact that I got a killer package online with Travelocity. I also liked the fact that with Melia, you get all of the amenities one would expect at a nicer American hotel (A/C, elevator, minibar) The hotel itself didn't disappoint. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and aside from the tub with the absurdly high step-in (if you have mobility issues, be sure to ask about this - it's that high) everything was perfectly lovely. The lobby was nice, decor was pleasing, and as for prices at the hotel bar and restaurant, hey, it's in a hotel - what did you expect? Actually, my girlfriend and I had dinner at the restaurant, and we had a great meal with drinks for approximately 75 bucks - in other words, standard NYC/London/Paris prices. The only rubs I had were the inadequate breakfasts (7 bucks for a roll and coffee isn't acceptable anywhere) and the expensive Internet service that we paid for that didn't work. As for the location, yeah, it's out of the way. Public transport is practically non-existent (the 892 bus to the Metro can charitably be described as capricious) and the ride down the hills is very rough, so again, if you're not the hardiest traveler or prefer your transit on the plusher side, this isn't a good option. During our 4 days there the shuttle ran reasonably well and on time, but it got stuck in traffic once (hence the bus trip) and it runs infrequently. If you want to stay out at night, you need to take a cab; they cost us about 18 Euro from the city center. On the plus side, however, it's in the middle of nowhere, so it's quiet and you'll get a good night's sleep. In regard to the lines other travelers described, we only had a problem once with people not being let on. You know the way we made sure we didn't run into any problems - we showed up early! Barring any large tour groups or parties, you'll have a seat if you show up 10 minutes before the bus is supposed to leave from the hotel and from the pickup by Ottaviano, add another 10 minutes on, especially at night. What I liked the most about this place was that I got a premium hotel for pennies on the dollar with built-in rest assured thanks to the location. If you separate the hotel from the location, it's an absolute winner, and if you have a private car, it should be a no-brainer. If not, well, that's where priorities come in. If you don't mind the shuttles, paying for the occasional cab, and value a good night of sleep, Melia is for you. If you're a nightowl, don't require amenities, and location is essential, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Far from city center”
Reviews.Author: kelfk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent, it's clean and the staff provided good service, however the location is quite far from Rome's city center. I booked this place for our last day of stay in Rome to connect to the airport. They only provide shuttle (very nice big bus) to and from the city at scheduled hours. Too bad they didn't have any shuttle to/from the airport which would have been a plus. Taxi to airport costs 40Euros +. We were lucky to share a cab with another couple. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are in Rome for a few days and have sights to see. Internet access is not free. Meals at hotel restaurant is average, but price is higher than restaurants outside. But since it's not close to anywhere, we just ate at the restaurant for our last supper in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoD
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but a little far away from everything. I would have rated it a little higher but they gave our phone number out to other guests to call us at 5:45 a.m. on the one morning we could sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel BUT inconvenient to get to”
Reviews.Author: LondonBoesman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Easter. Our first big problem was getting from Ciampino airport to the hotel. Our flight landed 21:40 at Ciampino airport. The public transport from Ciampino airport to Rome central is very limited. We booked tickets on the Terravision bus service to Termini station. The first bus departing from Ciampino airport was at 22:30 and with the 40 minute bus ride we only arrived at Termini station around 23:15. According to our planning we would have taken the metro A line to the last station and then get bus 246 that would have taken us 700m from the hotel. The end result we were too late for the metro and we had to take a cab. Maybe this was a blessing as the hotel is situated in a location which could be quite difficult to find. A cab from Termini to the hotel is about 35 euros. We only arrived at the hotel midnight. We stayed in a superior room. The room was great! It was spacious, clean, had a new bathroom, nice LCD TV and very comfortable bed. The drinks in the mini bar were very pricy and therefore we avoided it. The breakfast which was included in our price, was average and I would have expected more from a hotel of this price and standard. It is however better than the most European hotel breakfasts. What soured our trip to Rome was the travelling between the hotel and central Rome. It was a nightmare! The first morning we had our breakfast so that we could catch the 10:00 shuttle bus. We were 15 minutes before the time waiting for the bus. Just after 10 the hotel staff came out and told us the bus already left as it was full. We walked to the nearest train station (approx 1km) and caught one of the busses from there. It took us about an hour to get to central Rome. That was not too bad. Getting back to the hotel shuttle bus (which only goes every 1.5 hours and the last one back at night is 10pm) can accommodate approximately 60 people, and the hotel has 270 rooms. So if you make the calculations you will see the chance of the bus being full every time is very good. That night we then decided to take the 892 bus from Cornelia station to the hotel. We waited for 30 minutes and then decided we will walk to next bus stop. At the next bus stop we took the same bus as that morning with the idea it will drop us at the station near the hotel. From the station you have to walk through the university ground to get the hotel. We did not think of the fact that the university grounds will be locked. After one of the Italian citizens felt sorry for us and taking us back to the hotel by car, it took us 2,5 hours to get from central Rome to the hotel. The next day we then decided to try the shuttle bus, but again that was full. We then stuck to the 892 bus. The 892 bus is the best alternative to the hotel shuttle bus, but you need to be patient when waiting for this bus. We could not find a timetable and therefore we waited sometimes only 5 minutes and other times up to 35 minutes. Eventually we used taxis, but that is an expensive option! Overall, whilst the room was nice and staff friendly, the location of this hotel (and infrequent shuttle service) mean that I would not recommend staying here if you want to go into the city of Rome and see the sights. Pay the extra money and stay in Rome! Trust me it will make your trip much more pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with polite staff, but out of the way and inconvenient to get to”
Reviews.Author: europetraveller28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Easter and upon arrival were told the only available room (despite it been booked for over 3 months( was a smoking room - I refused this room, and after been told there was no other options, we were upgraded into a non-smoking deluxe room - so that was good. The room was lovely, clean new bathroom and comfortable bed. However, it was very hot and stuffy and the fan/air conditioning did not seem to work - it was only April so I don't know what it would be like in the summer. The windows couldn't be opened. The worst thing about the hotel was the location. if you have a car it would have been ok, but if not you rely on the hotel shuttle bus (which only goes every 1.5 hours and the last one back at night is 10pm - and was full both nights we tried to use it so we had to get a cab for 15 euros anyway and another morning it was full and we had to wait another 1.5 horus to get to the city). There is a local bus, but it is infrequent, and you have to be prepared with tickets before you get on (which you CANNOT buy from the hotel - so really have to get them from the station the day before) so not really an option for us as we didn't expect to need the tickets as we assumed we could get the hotel bus into the city. The breakfast which was included in our price, was average and I would have expected more from a hotel of this price and standard. Also the drinks in the hotel bar were ridiculously priced - 5 euro for a small glass of coke, 9 euro for a 1/2 pint of beer. Overall, whilst the room was nice and staff friendly, the location of this hotel (and infrequent shuttle service) mean that I would not recommend staying here if you want to go into the city of Rome and see the sights. Stay closer and near a metro station would be my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend away.”
Reviews.Author: PrestonDave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia Aurella in Rome on Friday and Saturday night, Feb 12 th and 13 th. Good points about the hotel. All the staff were very helpful and pleasant, our lack of Italian was not a problem as the staff we encountered all spoke some English. The rooms were very nice, clean and tidy and the hotel was quiet at night so we had no trouble sleeping. The hotel ran a bus shuttle into Rome, stopping right next to the metro link at Cipro Musei Vaticani, first bus in to Rome from the hotel was at 08:00 hours, the last bus back at night was 22:00 hours, with numerous shuttle trips throughout each day, each trip took about 20 mins. The only bad points for the hotel was that the food was dear if you bought any that was not already included in the price of the hotel, and the bar drinks seemed a bit steep at 16 euros for two medium glasses of beer, although you did get crisps and nuts with your beer at the bar. The location is a bit out of the way if you are travelling from Ciampino airport, a taxi would cost you 55 - 60 euros each way. We used the Terravision bus service from Ciampino airport into the main Stazione Rome central terminal for the coaches and trains, cost 4 euro's in and 6 euro's out, tickets bought at the airport and in the coach terminal, run roughly every half hour each way. Taxi from the vatican on the Friday night was 30 euro's, but if we had known about the shuttle pick up point, we would have used that as it wasn't far from the vatican. This was our first visit to Rome and we spent as much time as we could seeing the sights, you need good walking shoes as some of the paths are very uneven and you could sprain an ankle very easily. The traffic was hectic to say the least and you have to have your wits about you every time you cross the road. Heard alot about pick pockets but did not encounter any problems, all the bar staff and restaurant staff were nice and pleasant and again spoke English. Used the metro links which was efficient and cheap enough, bought a day pass for 4 euro's. Monuments and fountains did not disappoint, did a guided tour of the Colosseum and the Roman forum for just 16 euro's which was a bargain. Tour guides were excellent and the two tours lasted about 3 hours, you also jumped the long queues of people waiting to get in at both sites so this was well worth the money. Did not bother with the vatican museum as time was short on this trip and we were told that you need more than a full day to take everything in, although we did spend a couple of hours in St Peter's.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonJc83
Reviews.Content: From the second we stepped in to the second we stepped out, we were looked after. I had never been to Rome before, and the staff were great. They had a free coach service to and Rome, and the times were very frequent, more like every hour, and it was totally free. Although the hotel is slightly, out of the way, it was nice to stay in a quiet area. Our trip was a birthday gift for my fiancee and she loved it. The hotel resturant is a littly pricey, however, ask the staff for a nice resturaunt who actually come pick you up and drop you back.

Reviews.Title: “we had a fab time....”
Reviews.Author: johev
Reviews.Content: For my partners 40th birthday and our first trip abroad together, we had a great time. We had no problem with service in the hotel, the room was spaceous and clean. Location is a bit far out of the city centre but the free shuttle bus service makes up for that, tho please note to be sharp for the bus on your return to hotel. we managed to see all the main attractions in rome and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: roamingTeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overhauled after I visited so it may be better today. The rooms were large compared to all the others we stayed in, and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonBigtony
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here on our 1st year wedding anniversary,we wanted to book a posh hotel as it was a special occation. We were not dissapointed with this hotel,the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was excellent,lovely fittings and fitments,the bed was huge and comfortable,the bathroom was a good size and had all the mod cons. An exrat bonus was i could book a smoking room,unheard of in the UK. The hotel shuttle bus was very helpful getting in and out of the city centre,running 10 times each way. All in all we were very pleased with the hotel. The only downside was the hotel bar was expensive,6 euro for a small coke.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TriciaG2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aurelia Antica Suite, was very enjoyable place to stay nice rooms and clean. And the best of all 5 mins away by foot form the Vatican and also close to the subway for easy travel.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Aurelia Antica Hotel was a severe disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: Frugal-Bear
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Italy mainly on vacation. But I was asked to do some work near Melia Aurelia Antica Hotel on 21 October, and, seeing the good reports in Tripadvisor on that hotel, asked to be booked there for two nights, with checkout on 22 October. So, we were not disappointed by the hotel's distance from the center of Rome, the inadequate shuttle service, or the €50 per day it would have cost us to commute by taxi to central Rome. The room, a superior double, and ensuite bath were good sized, adequately furnished, and seemed fairly clean. The bed was large and comfortable; the linens good. The room was quiet. It was ready when we arrived and was made up well the next day. But the room was permeated by the stench of cigarette butts (though they had been removed). Moreover, when we arrived in late afternoon, sunlight was pouring in, the windows were closed, and the room was hot. I asked about the air conditioning, and was told that the single system for the whole hotel had been changed to heating, and that I should open a window. The window opened only narrowly. I would have asked for a switch to cleaner-smelling room not exposed to the afternoon sun, but we did not have time for that. Next morning, we realized that the side of the bathtub was so high that neither of us could easily step in and out of it, and that there was no grab bar to help. We had to help each other in and out of the tub and needed to be careful to avoid slipping on its wet, rounded bottom. The cheapest way to use a computer in the lobby for a few minutes was to buy a 40-minute card for €10. The included buffet breakfast was adequate in the variety of foods, but the quality was only acceptable, not very good. There are no eating places or delis outside the hotel within easy walking distance. The hotel restaurant has a very limited menu, with generally acceptable but not excellent food and beverages, served in smallish portions at high prices. None of the makings of a mixed salad my wife ordered were fresh and crisp, and some were decadent. But when she pointed that out to the waiter and asked him to take it back, he angrily asserted that there was nothing wrong with the salad. When she insisted, he removed it, but the €12 charge for it was included in our bill, and only removed when I appealed it to the front office manager at check out. When checking out, we asked the clerk to call a taxi for the airport. We were then told that by the front office manager that he had called our hosts the previous day and been told that they would pay only the charges for the room itself. The hotel manager should have raised that issue with us the previous evening. Lacking time to resolve it, I paid the bill and got a receipt. But the hotel’s printer was working so poorly that the receipt was barely legible. Compared with other lodging experiences in Italy over forty-five years, Melia Aurelia Antica Hotel was a great disappointment. The chain's owners would do well to replace this hotel's managers with some competent people or, if it is a franchise, to terminate Melia's relationship with it.

Reviews.Title: “Trafalgar”
Reviews.Author: wooleyoneeye
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience,. Found the staff friendly at the front desk. supper one of my favorites in Italy, really good, the squid, delicious. People at he hotel very helpful and friendly. Would definitly stay again, only before Sept because of the pool closure. Only bad thing is the orange eggs in the morning ewewl

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and shuttlebus service. Restaurant let it down.”
Reviews.Author: diplomsk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the standard double room we stayed in was big, with a nice bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The shuttlebus service (approximately 50 seats) was excellent and arrived on time for our entire 5 day stay. It stops approximately 5 minutes walk to the Vatican. We, admittedly, didn't attempt to use the infamous last bus, but regularly took the 830pm bus back to the hotel. We did, on one occasion, witness a couple being asked to leave the bus due to lack of seats on the 830pm bus; they apparently don't let you stand. The breakfast is worth adding to your trip. It has a wide variety of foods including bowls of fresh, mixed fruit, yoghurts, nuts and bread rolls. You also get the choice of an 'American style' breakfast, with sausages and scrambled eggs. The one area that let the hotel down was the restaurant. The meals were fairly expensive and the drinks were extortionate! We paid 14 euros for a small glass of wine and a 250ml bottle of Becks! When we did have a meal at the restaurant, we were forced to choose from the 'short menu' and was given a choice from a very small number of meals read out to us by the very disinterested waiter. We both ordered the lasagne, costing 13 euros, and received what was clearly the corner of a pre-made, larger lasagne, heated up with no extra vegetables or sides. So, if you can avoid the restaurant, The Melia Aurelia Antica is an excellent hotel, with an excellent transport service to Rome centre. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great lifeguard”
Reviews.Author: monseee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good option for any purpose of trip. However, anybody knows the name of the lifeguard in 2009?? H e was very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and the shuttle bus works fine!”
Reviews.Author: JoeGem
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in July as a part of a birthday get away. From the previous reviews, our only reservation prior to the trip was the shuttle bus. From the moment we arrived, until the moment we left, the staff could not do enough to help. Breakfast was not provided in the deal, but on checking in, we were presented with a 'buy one get one free' voucher. This proved great value and we utilised this on the excellent continental breakfast each day. An fantastic advantage of staying here is the swimming pool. Many of the central hotels in Rome don't offer this luxury, and after a day of walking round the Coliseum, it is great to be able to plunge into cool waters. The room was big and spacious, very clean with a great bathroom, and nicely air-conditioned. As previously mentioned, our one concern was the shuttle bus, so much so that prior to leaving the UK we arranged to pick up a hire car from the airport. This turned out to be a slight waste of money! The shuttle bus is frequent enough, and although the last pick up from the city centre is 22:30, we found a cheap way round the solution... Most tourists who go to Rome utilise the cheap 3 or 7 day underground passes. These are fantastic value and I strongly recommend getting one. If you miss the last shuttle, take the tube to the end of the line and from there you will be able to get a cab (not speaking the lingo isn't a problem as we got ours by walking into a restaurant who were kind enough to order one for us). From there it cost us about €15 to get back to the hotel. If you have the money to stay in a 5* hotel in the centre of Rome, then you probably won't be reading this review. For those of you like us who were looking to visit one of the most beautiful cities in Europe without splashing out a fortune, we cannot recommend the Melia Aurelia enough. We would have no hesitations in returning!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, shuttle NOT a problem”
Reviews.Author: ngjer
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel over a weekend in august. the hotel was very clean, comfortable and quiet with nice rooms and a great view. We didn't find any problem getting closer to the city center with the shuttle which we took 4 times though we didn't use the last shuttle of the day which gets most of the complaints in the other reviews. there is no problem getting back and forth to the hotel with other forms of transport. the 892 bus stops right outside the hotel and goes to the Baldo Degli Ubaldi Metro station which is on the A line (third stop from Battisttini). the bus runs every 15 minutes till 12:30 at night. We got a great price through hot-wire and would definitely recommend it warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at Rome”
Reviews.Author: lillianLimaPeru
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I've been, not only for their accomodations, but for their staff. It is not close to Rome, but they have a shuttle bus that takes you daily and at different schedules to the city for free. They also have a swimming pool, as well as a great buffet breakfast. The staff is out of this world, they are nice and take good care of you. It is a beautiful place to stay, and it is very nice to return, after walking all they long, to a really nice hotel surrounded by trees. We forgot money at the safe box in our room, so we had to return and every penny was there, for us, the best place to stay in Rome. Lillian

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: wilkvale
Reviews.Content: hotel was amazing. very clean very tidy very quiet. hotel is abit out of the way of town but makes it ideal for those relaxing nights away from the hussle and bussle of the town. staff very very friendly and hotel room was very nice with plenty of space!! the shuttle bus we had no problems with getting there and back at a sensible time. yes the last one does get busy but people have to understand everyone is in the same situation they want to get back for free!! me and my fiancee stayed in town on the saturday night and got a taxi back, we gott he metro line A (the red one) to baldo degli ubaldi and flagged a taxi from here which cost us, 1 euro each for the metro and 10 euro for the taxi. the 10pm bus does get busy and some people can be rude and try to push there way on!! from what we had read before we left, we expected a small mini bus. but found it was a fully air-con coach ( very nice) please do not let this put you off such a gorgeous hotel as this will make your saty extra special. 12 euro isn't to much for the metro and taxi surely?? just a few brain cells can see it doesnt have to be a big prolem like it seemed to be for some!! would highly recommend and we will definately be returning in the future. A******

Reviews.Title: “Never again to Melia Aurelia, thanks to shuttle bus "service"”
Reviews.Author: CoupleFromHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Melia Aurelia in July 2009. We got a great deal from Melia Aurelia, it was 50 € per night including breakfast (which was really nice). We knew the location is bad, but the hotel has a shuttle bus service and that sold Melia Aurelia for us. Huge mistake. Hotel says in their websites that thay don´t guarentee that you get the seat from the bus, but still, it suppose to be 4 star hotel, so you would think that they don´t advertise someting they really can´t deliver especially when the location is difficult and most of the customers are quite dependent on this bus "service". The shuttle bus "service" is a big joke so I advice everybody who are thinking to book a room from this hotel: Don´t count on the bus service, book this hotel ONLY if you have a own car. The shuttle bus was full almost every time we try to get in. One night we were coming back from the town and it was the last bus going to hotel 10 pm from Ottaviano metrostation, and there was three times more people waiting the bus than what the bus can take. People were pushing and shouting to get in to bus, it was really awful. Half of the family might got in the bus and the other half didn´t, and that´s it, nothing you can do. You can´t keep seats even to your children. The whole situation was so humiliating, normal people (young and old) fighting and screaming to get in the bus!!!! How any hotel can offer this kind of "service" for it´s customers???? It beats me. So never again for us or any of our friend who are going to Rome. Since the hotel is in middle of nowhere (really, closest shops and restaurants are probably 3-5 km from the hotel) you can see this difficult location also in prices in hotels restautants and bars; cola costs 5 euros, normal drinks cost 11,50 €. There is a shop in the hotel, but you can´t buy even a bottle of water from there, they only sell postcards and other turist junk. Otherwise, rooms were roomy and quiet and pool area was great after long day at the town. We were thrilled about the hotel at the first evening when we got there, but next morning and the bus "service" made us to forget all the good stuff in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing hotel, would definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: PamBerdoues
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again without hesitation. I stayed here for a week with my husband and 9 year old daughter, we had a lovely time, the hotel is perfect and the staff are great. The room was lovely, very spacious and clean, lovely bathroom. We got a good deal for our room with breakfast included which i would recommend as i think its expensive to pay for otherwise. At first we thought the prices were a bit steep but then discovered that's Rome, its all expensive. The hotel is in peaceful surroundings away from the hustle of the city. We used the courtesy bus to and from Rome and never had a problem getting a seat whatever the time. The one time we arrived late at the pickup point and didn't want to wait for the next bus we just got the metro to the next stop along towards the hotel (for 1 euro each) and got a taxi back from there, it halved the taxi fare.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from sites but quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: SUNNY_TOR
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was a standard 4 star North American hotel. Great price for the hotel quality. Very clean, air conditioning, North American style bathroom. The staff were helpful and friendly. Its a short taxi ride from the airport but far from the sites. It took about 30 minutes (depending on traffic) to get to the Vatican City area wtih the hotel shuttle. Once you were there it was very easy to get around. Catching a taxi at night is inconvenient if you miss the shuttle cause you need to ask someone with a landline to call a taxi for you. We encountered no problems with the shuttle, but people were left behind because of full buses at the peak times of day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't rely on the shuttle bus”
Reviews.Author: lrdyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in June. Knew the hotel was in the outskirts of Rome but the convenience of the shuttle bus sold it to us. But what a huge mistake. Before we came here we spent three nights in a B&B in the middle of Rome ( Il Covo ) and thoroughly enjoyed the location and experience. When at the Melia though you could be anywhere, all sense of location is lost. Deluxe room was large and comfy but looked quite dated with some very dodgey electrical sockets, pool was ok and most of the staff were very pleasant. But.............. Food.......... Paid 70 euros for easily the worst meal that we had in Rome. Eat elsewhere or bring something back with you Breakfast.....Jam excellent, rest of it mediocre. The bacon and sausage were very poor quality and the colour of the eggs need to be seen to be believed.
