Quantity there but quality poor Shuttle bus.........If you are planning to use this from the hotel you must get ther twenty minutes early or you may not get a seat. Returning from Rome in the evening it does not matter what time you get there because the driver just opens both sets of doors and it turns into a mad free for all. We queued for thirty minutes and got left behind along with many others. Make sure you have enough money for a taxi otherwise it will be a long walk.(The queue at reception is usually not people checking in but people complaining about the bus) Drink........Bring your beers back with you...8 euros for a small beer and 11.50 euros for a vodka and tonic, even at the pool bar. Don't plan a stag do here! Internet........10 euros for 45 minutes Car parking..........Did not use but 16 euros a night As you can see you may get a good rate to stay here but once you are here there is absolutey nothing nearby hence the high prices I suppose. To sum up, as an overnight stop this might be ok, but if you are planning to use as a base for exploring Rome keep well away, book this place at your peril. Find a hotel or B&B near the sights, you will have a much better time

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has its problems...”
Reviews.Author: JustForFun23
Reviews.Content: I snagged a very cheap rate (less than 100USD/night), but I would still think twice before staying again. The hotel had difficulty understanding my fluent English and Spanish (ironic for a Spanish hotel chain). Do NOT eat in their "breakfast room" unless it is included in your rate. I was gouged $50 Euros for two "American breakfasts," which amounted to nothing more than coffee, juice, disgusting eggs, and chopped up hotdogs. Restaurant/bar food/room service was mediocre yet laughably overpriced. But, the grounds and rooms were immaculate: we appreciated the little niceties like surround sound in the bathroom, motion sensor lights in the halls, etc. Also, the shuttle bus to Ottaviano Metro station is a great plus. Do arrive early, though, or you may find yourself waiting another two hours for the next one. (TIP: Leave the Ottaviano Metro area ASAP. Shady area with terrible food.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, out of the way”
Reviews.Author: JPAU
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Melia Roma Aurelia Antica as part of a Trafalgar tour (Italian Holiday). The hotel while nice and clean was far away from Rome proper yet served our needs nicely as a jumping off point. The room was clean and well furnished – shower curtain/door was awkward which resulted in water all over the floor. Our only meals at the hotel was the breakfast buffet which was plentiful and acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Agata-Iwona
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Melia for three nights, It was a great, hotel is a high standard, it is on the outskirts of the town, but you can take a local bus, 892, and it will take you to the nearest metro,I would definately choose this hotel once again , superb!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the Courtesy Bus”
Reviews.Author: Johnny99Uk
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is a really clean well kept hotel with great service from most of the staff. We stayed for 3 night and had booked a double non smoking room. On arrival we were offered a twin smoking room with additional facilities for the disabled.It took some discussion with the duty manager to resolve this. ( still not what we booked) Finally what they don't make clear is the first come first served policy with the courtesy bus, its horrific to watch the people left at the bus stop as the final bus pulls away at 11pm and those who have missed it are left to find a taxi in Rome, a journey that will set you back 15 - 20 Euro's to the hotel. Its miles away from anywhere so you need the bus to enjoy the wonders Rome has to offer - even the simple requirement of a meal out Be clear on what you are getting !

Reviews.Title: “if this is a 5 star, I'd hate to see a 3 star....”
Reviews.Author: 2fun4maine
Reviews.Content: First let me begin by saying I have stayed at the Melia in Cancun..which was GREAT! This compared to that was a rundown...used to be nice resort...with faded carpets, 80's bedspreads and a mildewed smelling sink...not even close to a 5 star...the staff however were wonderful and they do have a bus that shuttles you in to the Metro to get into Rome..but it is an absolute frenzy trying to get on the bus on the return trip people pushing and puting their arms up so as to let their wives etc on before another person, it was shameful to be a part of the process...all that had to happen was the bus driver to tell everyone to stand back and form a line..I am assuming he got some ammusment from watching the "adults" act like children at a one swing playground..not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: s17acs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Melia for four nights from the 15th April. Our check in was very efficient and our room was a good size with flat screen TV, mini bar, electronic safe and a small seating area. We did not eat or drink at the hotel although the menu for the restaurant looked good and was priced reasonably when compared with eating out in Rome itself. The bar prices were a bit steep but there was a nice outside seating area just opposite. The hotel shuttle bus was a necessity for us. The journey took between 15 and 25 minutes depending on traffic and dropped off at the Ottaviano metro stop. For three of the four days we stayed the bus was a plain white 34 seater with the hotel name on a piece of A4 paper in the windscreen which filled up very quickly. On the fourth day a much larger 57 seater single decker coach was operating which had the hotel branding displayed all over! I did not ask but I presume the larger bus was being serviced or something meaning the smaller bus was only a temporary stand-in. I would advise you turn up at least 20 to 30 minutes before the bus you want to get (in either direction) as a lot of people were using the service and throughout our stay there were almost always people left behind to wait on the next bus. The hotel's no standing rule was very striclty enforced by the drivers. If the larger bus is always used this is unlikey to be such a problem. For the price I paid for the hotel I could not be happier. I booked through Tiscali Travel (powered by Expedia) who gave me a voucher code (now expired) which meant my four nights stay only cost £205.97 - far cheaper that most hotels in Rome. In conclusion, if you get a good price and you are prepared to wait on the shuttle bus you should not be disappointed by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, but probably not unless you have car”
Reviews.Author: calvino
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Melia 10 or so times over the last 5 years. I've always enjoyed it. It is clean, it has nice staff, and is definitely a 4-star hotel. Back a bunch of years ago my family came along, and they loved the pool. I recommend this to anyone, but I'll be cautious with tourists. I think if you want to see Rome, you're better off paying a little more (maybe) for a 3-star downtown, even if you do have a car. This great hotel is not in a great place, and I gather from other posters that the bus service to downtown is not a lot of fun. One the other hand, if you are "passing through" -- going from the North to Naples and you'd like to break up the day, or you are either coming or going to Fiumicino and you'd like a night to unwind AND you have a car, then this place is ideal! A nice thing is the restaurant, I've always found their food much better than one would expect from a hotel restaurant. (Perhaps American hotels' restaurants have lowered my expectations.) An annoying thing is their internet, which is rather expensive and seems to come with gigabyte limits. I didn't spring for that. I also think that the hotel needs to spruce things up a little: I've seen it getting just a little shaggier (paint, etc.) since I started coming to it. A hint is to park around back, by the Conference Center. Almost everyone does, anyway. The hotel unwisely seems to have instituted a parking fee - first 45 minutes free - so now apparently no one uses the hotel's parking.

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: PolkaDots
Reviews.Content: Our group of 10 flew in a day before our cruise to get a chance to tour Rome. At 9 in the morning the hotel had our rooms ready so we could freshen up before heading into the city. We took the shuttle provided by the hotel into the city. No complaints at all. This saved us so much hassle and expense. After a long day of touring, we were so thankful to come "home" to clean rooms with very deep bathtubs. Great for warming up after a chilly day and soaking our sore feet. We had a decent, although pricey, dinner from the bar near the lobby. In the morning we enjoyed the best breakfast of our entire trip. In addition to eggs, potatoes, and various meats they offered fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt, cereals and several types of coffees, juices and champagne. I'd love to go back and stay there for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in bad location”
Reviews.Author: JT0505
Reviews.Content: Make sure you want to stay here before you book. This hotel is in the middle of an industrial state far and isolated from the center, despite not being far from Rome downtown. It is alright for package tour travellers being taken around in groups, business travellers wanting to stay in this particular areas or airline crews too tired to care. There is no public transportation nearby to or from downtown, only the hotel bus which can be full and does not run at night. Advertising as being in a park is only a half truth, you can´t go jogging around unless you want to risk your life in roads with barely any sidewalks, full of trash and prostitutes. They do have a little gym where you can line up for your turn to use the one and only treadmill. On the other hand, the hotel itself is nice, better than the average Melia, and the staff really go out of their way to help customers. The restaurant is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: STERR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay but for the location. I should say it is in the boonies. There is a hotel shuttle which runs from a metro station(OITAVIANO), a 30 minute ride. But there is only one bus. So if you miss the 8:30p trip, you will have to wait on the road side till the 9:45p. I wish the frequency could be increased. Anyways, we had issues from the moment we got down at the Rome terminal train station. We called the hotel to find out the easiest way. We were told to take a cab all the way. We knew it would cost us 40 - 50 Euros. When we asked about Metro, we were asked to get down at a different station (CORNELLA). We were never told about the shuttle stop at Oitaviano. The second issue was the room AC. For some reason, the staff decided to turn off the AC during nights. We were told to open the window doors or use the fan. The Fans did not work either. So we kept the window open since it was a warm night. The third issue was with the breakfast. When we went to the breakfast room, the lady asked us to go down to another room. When we went to the other room the lady kept asking us about Gulliver travels. I have no idea why. We kept saying NO. We were on our own. So after 10 minutes of talk, we were asked to go back upstairs to the big American breakfast room. Again after 5 minutes talk, they let us in. My wife was really [-] of with this. So we were just waiting for about 20 minutes. I still did not know why the lady kept asking about Gulliver travels. When you make your reservation, make sure you have the breakfast and that there is not confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theryguy23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for three nights. We loved the city and thought our hotel was great as well. The Melia is an incredible four star hotel. The basic rooms are immaculately clean and very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was the best that we have had in Europe - it had everything. We found this hotel for only $150Canadian/night on Expedia. It was an amazing deal The biggest draw back is the location. It was pretty far from the centre of Rome. We tried to get to the hotel on public transit and it was almost impossible. I would HIGHLY recommend taking a cab from the two airports to the hotel. It will be expensive but way way way way way less stressful. There is a shuttle bus every hour from the centre of Rome to the hotel - this was really nice to go to and from everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at very reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: swivellingmonk
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a result of the good reviews on here and the added bonus of a pool on a sightseeing holiday. The hotel was a typical conference hotel with all the good things that implies - excellent service, good food (although I agree that the restaurant was a little expensive and the pool bar was horrendously expensive), good rooms etc The free shuttle to the Vatican area of Rome was great, although a bit of a tie. It leaves every 75 minutes from 8am - 11pm with a break at tea time. It was nearly full a couple of times but there was always enough room - and that was during the height of summer! My only little gripe was that we ended up hurrying to finish our meal a couple of times just so we didn't miss the bus and have to wait another 75 minutes. The pool area was a real bonus with loads of sunbeds and a relaxed atmosphere. 2 English news channels on the TV. What more can I say - just wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Travellers20081406
Reviews.Content: Went for 7 days in August - Rome is truly amazing. The Hotel was very good and did not have any real complaints. The staff were fantastic. The hotel restaurant was ok - my partner and I are vegetarians and there were not as many options as we would have liked. The swimming pool was great. The courtesy bus took on average 17 minutes to get to the Vatican where you get dropped off and picked up. The first coach is at 8 and the last one back is at 11pm. The hotel was great value for money and was not expecting a lot less and was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “A Resort hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Danosia
Reviews.Content: Not a typical hotel for Rome. This was the last hotel we stayed at during a 21-day trip throughout Italy. Since we are traveling with 2 kids, I decided to book this hotel because it seemed geared toward family and I must say, I was impressed. Although this is not a business hotel, we found all the services/amenities of a business hotel AND the services/amenities of a typical resort hotel. We reserved a junior suite for the family - which turned out to be 2 connecting rooms - and much to our surprises came with additional perks and attention. Not sure if everyone gets the same level of attention but the staff certainly treated us very well because we were staying in a "suite". The whole family enjoyed the setting and the pool and although the hotel is located away from the main attractions, the hotel offers a shuttle service to a subway station / prime tourist spot. Overall, we were surprised and pleased with this hotel. It certainly was different from other hotels in Rome we stayed at in the past.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel away from the city”
Reviews.Author: Max_smart61
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from July 14 to 16, and overall I would say this is a good hotel for the money. There's a nice pool area and the complimentary breakfast buffet is good . Service was decent, except for one small problem - the morning after our first night in the hotel we were awakened by the sound of hammers pounding on the floor beneath us. I made a complaint to the front desk, but nothing was really done as it happened again the next morning. Other than this unfortunately incident, our stay was very pleasant and the shuttle service into Rome is excellent - always on time despite some horrific traffic & construction in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - poor service, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: FamilyStar
Reviews.Content: The staff was absolutely the worst, very unprofessional and could care less if their guests are comfortable or in need of anything. I was truly shocked by the rude attitude and discourteous replies to the simplest inquiries. The facilities were not bad, but certain areas were a little run down and could use a coat of paint at the very least. It is not the 4 star facility they claim to be. We booked 3 rooms here for a family vacation and everyone experienced the same behavior from staff on several occasions. As we sat by the pool one afternoon, several other guests remarked to us that they experienced the same awful behavior from staff so it was clear that it wasn't just our family's experience. The final straw came when a lifeguard was so rude to me that I just couldn't believe it. My young daughter was wearing a plain white t-shirt in the pool over her bathing suit because she was sunburned. The lifeguard yelled at us and told me she had to take it off. I told him she was sunburned and mentioned that there was another child in the pool earlier wearing a t shirt over their suit and he didn't have a problem with that. He then yelled at me and said "I am the lifeguard!" I was so upset about the way he spoke to me -- completely uncalled for and out of line. (There is no sign posted anywhere that says "no t-shirts in pool" or anything like that.) When I went to the front desk to ask for the manager, I was first told he wasn't there. Then a moment later I was told he was too busy to come out of his office. Too busy to come out and help a guest??? I asked that he please call me in my room. After one hour and no phone call, I went back downstairs. Finally the front desk manager came out. He listened to my complaint but basically said he could do nothing about it. For the record, we saw other guests with complaints at the front desk throughout our stay. One night we had dinner in the main dining room. The service was very slow. After about 30 minutes, we all had our meals except for my 80 year old mother who ordered a simple pasta. They said it would be ready in 10 more minutes. After 20 minutes and still no pasta, we asked our waiter to check on it. He said another 10 minutes. For pasta! After another 10 minutes and still no meal, the manager came over and said 10 more minutes. He also acted very indignant, as if we were completely out of line asking him to check on it. It finally arrived after a full 40 minutes, and was cold as ice. It should also be mentioned that there were only 3 other tables occupied at that time so it wasn't like the place was extremely busy. The poolside food/bar service was terribly slow although the food was fine. When my mother wanted to get part of her sandwich wrapped up to bring to her room because she couldn't finish it, she was told "no, that's not allowed." Because the hotel is on the outskirts of Rome, they have a shuttle bus to take you to and from the city. But it basically runs every 90 minutes, and if there are too many people waiting, then you don't get on -- which means you'd have to take a taxi into town or back to the hotel which cost approximately 25 Euro. It would be much more helpful if it ran a little more frequently. For internet service there is a charge of 10 Euro for forty minutes of use. There is a billiard table but you are also charged 10 Euro per hour. There was a charge for using an iron. We needed information about local buses, no one at the front desk knew the answer. We asked about a local church, again no one on staff knew where to find one. How can you have a staff that isn't familar with the local area? There is no real concierge to help you. The only decent thing was their breakfast buffet every morning; a lot of choices and there was one hostess there who was very nice. However, it is not included in the price of the room unless you pay extra. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families. They don't know the first thing about hospitality nor do they care. If we hadn't pre-paid through the travel agency, I would have checked out after the second day. With so many choices of hotels in Rome, this one is definitely not worth it on any level.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Banfila
Reviews.Content: The good things - the breakfast is very good and the rooms are good and air conditioned. However, the hotel service and the practicalities of staying here ruins everything. First this hotel is out of town so you rely on the hotel for all meals. They have an expensive menu which seemed to be dedicated to foreigners since we saw Italians having a cheap buffet and we were told they were allowed that because they have a special contract at the hotel. Then I wanted to iron my trousers but the hotel would not give me an Iron because apparently, it is against Italian law. The only way was to get a lady to iron them which they charged for and added a 30% charge for wanting them back the same day. For the record, the next hotel I stayed at had no problems giving me an Iron. You can use the hotel bus to go to town but you have to run on their schedule. If you are an independent sort of person this can be a little annoying since you are pretty stuck out there. You could get a taxi but the hotel has to call the taxi and here's the most annoying this about the whole transport issue and Rome itself. Taxi drivers are there to exploit foreigners. They start the meter when they receive the call, apparently. By the time they are at the hotel you are generally between 4 - 6 Euros down before you even get into the cab. The taxi meter in Rome is just an instrument of thievery. The taxi drivers tell you the reading is Km when they want to charge you a higher euro price. There are lot of tricks. The hotel does not take care to make sure that the taxi service that they use is good for their customers. Contrast with the hotel we stayed in after that, all the taxis they use are ensured by the hotel to be fair. Many occasions I saw many guests arguing or getting fed up with the hotel staff for one problem or another. Lastly, after we got fed up and checked out early and moved to a city hotel, I forgot my running shoes at the hotel. Two days and nobody called to tell me they had found it. Then we rang and one staff told us the found it. Then we rang again to arrange a pick up and the next staff swore they had not seen it. Not worth staying here even for the pool. Stay in town. In summary, the facilities are good but the package around and service are horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cattipoops
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! My husband and i stayed for 4 nights in July 08. Definitely a 4 star as it says. Good sized, clean rooms and the hotel staff are very friendly, providing correct and accurate advice as needed. Maid service everyday. I would recommend this hotel but due to the location you do need to get the courtesy bus into the city centre as it is a way out with not much in the nearby vicinity. However i knew this when booking the hotel from previous Tripadvisor reviews and the bus is on time and always enough seats so it wasn't a problem for us. Bus is approx every hour in and out of city. The out-of-town location is more than made up for in the reduced rates of the rooms (compared to hotels right in the city centre) and there is no traffic noise/disturbance when you go to bed which i suspect you would get closer into the city. We ate in the hotel some nights and some nights in the city, so can vouch for the hotel food. Very good service, quality and good selection on menu. The free glass of champagne in hotel restaurant on arrival for meal was a nice touch. The nights we ate out, we decided not to get the hotel bus home (last bus 11pm) and caught a taxi instead. Taxi ranks easy to find. From where the bus drops you in the Vatican district of the city the taxi ride back to the hotel was 20 Euros so not too bad. It's worth going out just to meet the locals and get some local/ traditional food/drink. We did lots of sightseeing whilst in Rome and I would say 3 or 4 days is enough to see all the major sights. July is hot to be walking about in the heat (35c) so would perhaps recommend to say my mum&dad to go in the spring or autumn when it's not so intense. If we came back to Rome again I would not have any qualms about booking this hotel again and would recommend it to others as a good base. My biggest criticism is the pool bar prices, majorly expensive but then Rome is a very expensive city. The cash machine in the hotel did come in handy! All in all this was a great base that allowed us to explore the city at our own pace and provided everything we needed for a great city break!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: alison.mather
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely stay at this very affordable hotel. Travelling with two small children is never easy and can get quite pricey to say the least; when you want two rooms; but not at this place. We booked direct with the hotel website and reserve a junior suite which comprised of two separate rooms with a sofa bed for the children. It was great. Plenty of space for us all. Incredibly helpful staff. Vast array of choice at a lovely breakfast. Very useful courtesy bus service that ran late into the evening 11.30 from recollection. Nice pool area which was a god send after a day site seeing. All in all a very positive experience and highly recommended. Top tip, if you book with the hotel website and join the loyalty card programme you collect points for free nights stays etc but perhaps more useful is the free upgrades and use of the business facilities/drinks and snacks for free. Well worth it we found.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubbenhall_traveller
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We stayed for 3 nights as part of a driving tour and were so pleased we selected this hotel. We arrived after a drive from Orvieto and were immediately impressed when we were given an upgrade to an executive room. This was huge and overlooked the pool area. The whole hotel was in very good condition with a great pool which is very pleasant after a day of sightseeing in the city. Breakfast was excellent with a full range on offer. We ate at the pool bar a couple of times and it provided excellent food at prices which were not too expensive. The staff were very freindly and welcoming in the main, but one of the pool attendants was a little officious. We found the free shuttle bus invaluable, it ran to time and to a timetable which fitted the guests requirements. If I had to be hyper-critical I would say that the drinks were expensive, and 14 Euros per night for car parking also a little over the top. However, the free shuttle did save parking charges in the City. All in all a great hotel with great facilities. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: ptcmom113
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights. We stayed at another hotel in Rome with my husband the first andl ast nights of our trip, with the Mela Roma in between. The other hotel is also 4 stars and in the middle of Rome (The Savoy). We would have to say that the Melia Roma is WAY superior to the Savoy. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are great, and there is a pool. Even if you eat at the hotel for every meal, you will still get a better deal than other hotels in the city. You can go and/or stay in town as long as you like if you want to avoid paying the hotel restaurant prices. They aren't that terrible, but it is still less expensive to eat in town. The shuttle is every 1 1/4 hours from 8 in the morning til around 11 at night. The Ottavianno Metro stop where you are taken is central to everything. The bus does tend to fill up in the simmer. We shared a cab back to the hotel one night and it was less than 20 Euros (divided by the 2 parties, less than 10) for the trip. Staff is friendly and helpful. I had some questions even before I arrived and was answered via e-mail almost immediately. We did not bother to upgrade our room, but it starts at 19 Euros per night. ]]We would not consider staying anywhere else in Rome if we ever go back. This should be a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: tanjafinland
Reviews.Content: melia roma aurelia antica hotel, ilaly We spend four nights at the hotel. It was very warm outside, over 30' every day and it was nice to stay at very good airconditional room. at the pool we were every day and there the prices were high. At the afternoon we take the free bus to the town and walked there several ours. Ones the bus was full and we shere a taxi with one guy. The price was about 12 euros. We eat every day a different restaurant in town and the prices were very different also. Our best pizza we eat near the busstop and the price was our sheepest, just about 18 euros for two pizza and half liter white wine. When you are just arrived at the airport don't take taxi inside where are several guys waiting for tourists. Go outside and teke the taxi there, you need to puy ten euros less.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ponos
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,outside of Rome,whith nothing arount.The shuttle bus is the best service from the hotel.Always on time and untill late at night.The stuff was also very helpful and the breakfast was very tasty.I will stay again at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: gman33_99
Reviews.Content: OK, this Hotel was really good, i booked it and got a night free on lastminute.com...it was a four star with a beautiful pool and really good gym. You can upgrade your room, and i recommend you get the senso room!!!! Front desk were really helpful above and beyond. My communication with the hotel before i got there was excellent, as i needed picking up from the airport. 55 euros and you get a big mercedes. a taxi will cost you about 40 euros. Rooms really nice and clean, with air con. For the aircon to work, shut the window, it triggers the air con to work. Just a few things that are maybe a downer, room service is expensive, we got a pizza and a chicken dish and it cost 38euros, service charge was 9 euros. And a pint of peroni cost about £8!!! but it did all over rome. It location is about 35mins out of rome but there is a bus that goes every 45mins into town, we went in may and we had the bus to ourselves, but in summer i guess its busy. Make sure you get to the bus 25 mins before it leaves if you want a seat in summer. there is no metro back to or near the hotel. Overall great hotel, great staff, expensive food and drink, but its so cheap to stay there. 4/5!!!

Reviews.Title: “Business or Conference Hotel That Also Serves Tour Groups”
Reviews.Author: cardinal&straw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like a Hilton or a Hyatt in the States. It has a conference center, small pool, and a restaurant or two. It is not located near ANYTHING AT ALL. However, the hotel runs a shuttle in and out of the city to a central Metro stop, the Otaviano Stop. This was very helpful. Since taxis are rather expensive from the hotel to the center of town. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms relatively spacious, and things were up to date. The beds could have been a bit softer, but I think in Europe the beds tends to run a little harder. We stayed at this hotel as part of a Trafalgar tour. In scheduling excursions or dinners double check the shuttle service if you decide to part from the tour.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - had a great time”
Reviews.Author: ManOnTheRun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just left Rome last week for a 7 days trip 19-26 April. We stay in this hotel and it was a great experience. The hotel is clean and have very good up-keep. The hotel shuttle was always on time. We stay out most of the days and it is a good service we could count on. We did use the 11:00pm return shuttle one night and we had the bus all to ourselves. I do have a few comments: We did not have the coffee maker in the room like the other reviewer said. I have mix feeling about this. Regular American coffee (coffee maker) and instant coffee are very common in US hotels but I think it could be blasphemy for the people who invented both the espresso and cappuccino. I think if they would provide hot water and also an ice maker would be great improvement. The air condition unit in the room gets too hot when it is cold outside. I think the heat/cool cross over could be set a little lower. We had to open the windows and the outside temperature was very nice. Not enough hot water when the hotel is full. April 25 was holiday and we noticed that the hot water ran out quickly when there were a big group of people checked in. While shuttle service was great but I could foresee problem when too many people count on the same time slot. We did not have any problem while we were there. Maybe in the summer, when the hotel would be fully booked. It could fill up an entire coach bus. However, the tour group should not be a problem since they would have their own bus anyway. The two gift shops have surprisingly good prices. We walked all over the place (even to Venice) and check on prices, the prices would only vary as little as 1 euro (of course higher) for the same item from the city street and shop. We did buy a few small things in the last minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WILTS_7
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and myself have just returned from a very pleasant 5 night stay at this hotel. Although it is situated out of the centre of Rome, there is an excellent courtesy bus that runs every 1.5 hours and was always on time, the journey takes approx 30 mins on a good day!. The hotel was excellent, clean, comfortable, helpful staff and very good food. Breakfast was the best we had ever had in a continental hotel with over 100 different items to choose from, there was even coffee and tea making facilities in the room!!! Views from the rooms not that great as it is situated in a business area but if you plan to be out all day then it really does not matter. Internet facilites good but expensive so only use if you really need to. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and will be interested to see what the new hotel will be like that is due to be built nearer the centre of rome by march 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pity about the internet”
Reviews.Author: disgrun
Reviews.Content: The Melia Roma Aurelia Antica hotel was a great find. We have stayed in Rome several times and this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. There are some drawbacks - travel time to Rome, non-availability of local shops, and costly internet - but we felt that these were outweighed by the positives. Check-in and cleanng staff are very pleasant and friendly - everyone makes a point of saying hi, which is great in a city like Rome where service staff are usually jaded and act like they hate tourists. The front desk staff gave us a ton of local travel info and helpful advice. And the room cleaning staff even cleaned our rooms late one evening, when we were having dinner, after a day when we had spent the whole time in the room. Breakfast is great - very large selection of foods, and the coffee is great (as you'd expect in Italy!). Make sure hat breakfat in included in your room price or it will be pricey (9 euros to 15 euros depending on continental or full). The bar coffee is pricey - 3.5 euros for a caffelatte, which in town would cost you little more than 1 euro. The restaurant is overpriced - hors d'oeuvres start at 10 euros, main dishes start at around 13 euros. Room service incurs a 9 euro charge. Newspapers - Italian papers and the Wall Street Journal are free to take to your room, and are also available in the breakfast room. It is a bit far out - the shuttle bus (always on time) runs every 1h15mins, even though local buses to the metro stop run from just outside the hotel every 20mins so you can always take one of those instead of waiting around. The shuttle bus ride takes 20-30mins to the Vatican area, depending on traffic. But it was great after a day in bustling Rome to get back to a quiet, clean and modern hotel in pleasant surroundings. For us, the main drawback was the pay-as-you-go internet service. It is fast wireless, but it is VERY expensive: 5 euros for half an hour, 25 euros for a day, or 70 euros for a week. For a hotel of this class, I would have expected free wireless internet, especialy as the hotel derives part of its business from conferences and conventions. Taxis to/from Fiumicino airport (Rome's main international airport) are about 42 euros. Make sure you get a public taxi. Simply put, you can opt for the same price and less service/worse rooms in the city centre in another hotel, or 4-star in large rooms in this modern hotel a bit out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lb1100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Oct 20-23, 2007 and loved it. It is removed from the center of Rome, but there is a shuttle that drops you off in the Vatican City area, and it runs every 1 hour & 15 mins. The shuttle was a huge plus and pretty convenient although it can fill up pretty quickly at popular times of the day. The hotel itself was really nice. The woman in the reception area was nice enough to take some time to review a map of Rome and the best way to use our 3 days there. Rooms were clean, fairly large, and there was a great restaurant that was open until 11pm. The buffet breakfast was also really great compared to other "continental" breakfasts that typically included croissants and coffee. I would definitely recommend this hotel (again if you don't mind being right in the center of tourist attractions) and I hear they are building a new one that is closer to the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BPD501
Reviews.Content: Removed but that was a HUGE plus. The bus was very prompt. Don't be shy about pushing your way to the front. If the bus fills up then the cab ride is spendy. We were able to upgrade our room and get a U.S. sized room for a VERY reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Location far away, but not a big problem.”
Reviews.Author: Jeeves27
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Melia Roma Aurelia is 30-40 minutes car ride away from the heart of Rome's center. However, the hotel has a charter bus that makes repeated trips to/from downtown from ~8 am to ~10pm most days. It was not a terrible inconvenience for me to schedule my daily activities around the bus. The hotel is furnished very well, with very modern amenities. Internet service is pay-as-you-go, which I found normal in various locations in Italy. The lobby is also very welcoming in its design. The staff are very friendly and helpful with currency exchange and other questions. The breakfast buffet was superb. Everything you could want was there for a nice, wholesome breakfast--fruit, cereals, pastries, eggs, meats, etc. Very complete spread. The outdoor pool area was also nice for laying out in the sun, or for cooling off in the water. Overall, the cost was a little high, but compared to other hotels in the city, and for the amenities they offered, I thought the Melia was the best pick for my tastes. I did a LOT of research on TripAdvisor.com before I selected the Melia, and I am glad I did. It paid off for me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, but located next to nowhere”
Reviews.Author: BullDozerP
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for four night family stay. Hotel and our room was nice and clean. Pool area was great especially with kids. Breakfast was average but ok. They were playing annoying background muzak in public areas like breakfast restaurant, reception and pool area. Location is a problem. Yes, It is peaceful and thats why we selected this hotel. But you cannot find any shops or restaurants nearby and hotels own restaurants has rip-off prices. For example 15 € for a burger meal in a snack bar by pool area. Beverage is not included and it will cost 7 € more. Hotel offered a free bus ride to the metro station nearby Vatican only. It didn't go to Piazza Navona anymore or maybe this is so only for a summer season. We had to buy a metro ticket to go to the center of Rome. Bus ride took over 30 minutes to one direction and there were not so many departures in a schedule. We had to wait every time.

Reviews.Title: “If you are tired of charming....”
Reviews.Author: JolieDiana
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after traveling around Italy for a month and staying in many below average accomodations without a/c. It was exactly what I needed. The hotel is on a par with a Marriott or Rennaisance, with modern rooms and good amenities, sheets, towels, toiletries. Our room looked out onto the pool area which was nice. The only negative about this place is the remoteness and the fact that they have you hostage and are able to charge incredibly exorbitant prices on food, i.e a cheese sandwich $22. a coke $7.00.. My advice is to arrive armed with plenty of drinks and snacks and then gorge yourself on the wonderful breakfast buffet and this place becomes a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Americansportswriter
Reviews.Content: Very quiet in the countryside near the airport, but a modern hotel with a direct, reliable shuttle to the Vatican area that saves you $30 in cabfare roundtrip. Americans will enjoy it other than the internet was down 2 of 3 days I was there, which isn't unusual in Italy. If you can handle a 20 minute ride into the tourist areas, it's a nice hotel. Rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday without the charm thanks to MELIA”
Reviews.Author: 1GARZA
Reviews.Content: I stayed 9 nights from the 2/4/07 and thought that some of the previous contributors to TRIP ADVISOR were a bit unkind to this hotel; after all this hotel belongs to MELIA. •Room. I was provided with a Superior Room of good size and in good order. I spent 9 nights complaining to the reception that the room was too hot and that I could not sleep well (28 Degrees centigrade). Explanations of various kinds were provided none of them satisfactory. The hotel could not provide an electric fan. Sleeping with the window opened meant that I was bitten by mosquitoes, suffered the smell from the kitchen below and could hear the noise. The hotel provides conventions facilities! •Location. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere and a few kilometers (see their website) is a gross understatement. Once in the hotel you are in their hands as there is nowhere else to go and their prices are high. For 1/2 a liter of water EUR 4, Say GBP 2.80. •Courtesy Bus. I have seen long queues forming ½ earlier and people in belligerent mood. If you miss the bus it will take over 1 and ½ hors to get to the hotel by public transport or EUR 15 by taxi if the traffic is not to bad and the taxi driver in nice !! •TV. Sky news is listed as available in the TV schedule in the room. This is not true. I wrote to Melia and no response yet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and City”
Reviews.Author: Oscarito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights in March 2007. The hotel was what we expected. We knew it would be far from the center, but knew they offered a shuttle service to the Piazza Venezia and Vatican. We used this service everyday and had no problems. The hotel was clean and the service was great. They have two shops in the lobby, which had good prices on souvenirs. We purchased the hotel taxi service from the airport to the hotel and then back to the airport for our departure. The service was great - hassle free and got to the airport on time. We bought the daily hotel breakfast upon arrival and were able to get a better price. Breakfast is good. Lunch and dinner at the restaurant is a bit expensive and the servings are small for what you pay, in my opinion. Use the shuttle service - if you dont, you’ll be paying too much for a cab - use the earliest departure 0800hrs and return at 0930hrs. You’ll have enough time to see the sights, shop, etc. Definitely would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Crap food, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: DonKebaza
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for almost a week. Booked it in Veener.com I think, so we didn't get the address before everything were paid for.. Big mistake. This hotel is far far away from the city center. We ended up taking the metro, tried a buss and finally found a taxi that took us the last stretch to the hotel. The hotel is nice enough, probably more suited for families with children than young couples. The food is bad, as someone else wrote, the breakfast wasn't complementary, and rather dull at that. We tried the restaurant once, cost us about 120 €, and it was appalling, especially when you know about the great food you get elsewhere in Italy.. The good part has to be the pool. After a long day of shopping and sightseeing a dip in the water really helped, than it was back on the buss, to eat proper food downtown. In short: clean rooms, monolingual staff, far far away from downtown, great pool. Italy won the W.C. in football, Forza Azzuri!!.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts, but mostly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MarkLV
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Melia was mixed. The main negative aspect of staying here is clearly the remoteness from the centre of Rome. The shuttle bus is quite big and spacious, but simply does not run enough journeys during the day! And the fact that there are no runs into town between 5.30pm and 9pm makes it impossible to return to the hotel for an afternoon rest and then go back into Rome for an evening meal - quite unacceptable. Infact, the shuttle bus times seem to be designed to suit the driver, not the hotel guests. The superior room we had was on the top (6th) floor, overlooking the back, so was fairly quiet, with only minor background traffic noise from a road some distance away. Unfrotunately the bed was rock hard and very uncomfortable for those who - like myself - are of bigger size. Fortunately, there was a sofa-bed in the room, and that was actually more comfortable! The TV channels had only two that were English speaking: CNN and Euronews. The third one - that wasn't working - was Sky News. Quite unbelievable for a 4 star hotel! Although we stayed in March, when the weather was already quite mild, the heating was switched on at full power, and the corridors of the hotel floors were oppressively hot. Predicatbly, the hotel rooms had no access to air conditioning, only heating. Quite absurd, given Rome's balmy mediterrenean location. the The other negative feature is the apparent unreliability of the alarm call service. We booked a wake up call for 8.20am on the morning of our departure, and the call arrived at 6.20am - a rude awakening, to put it mildly. On the positive side, the hotel restaurant was extremely good - one of the best I've ever tried. The food was simply wonderful, from beginning to the end, and the service of a very good standard. I certainly didn't find the restaurant too formal, simply polite and respectful - after all this is a 4 star hotel and not Butlins! We chose the special four course set dinner and were charged 76 Euros for the the two of us, (discounted from 84 Euros) - I consider that to represent excellent value for money. Certainly not expensive, given that this must be one of the best restaurants in Rome. The breakfast in the morning was also quite good, with a lot of choice, although the service was chaotic. The only let down - and this was quite a serious one - was the lack of proper bacon and sausages - they only offered a very thinly cut fried pancetta and some tasteless boiled frankfurters. And the scrambled eggs were obviously fried with oil rather than butter - this made them greasy and not very tasty. So the cooked part of the breakfast is totally inadequate for an Anglo-Saxon clientele, though the rest of it was actually very nice, with plenty of fruit, yoghurts and croissants of every type. Overall, the hotel was a great disappointment and I will not consider staying there again. The restaurant was the only high point, everything else a let down. My overall impression is that this hotel is well suited to Italian business people but not for foreign tourists seeking a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Out on alimb, but saved by the bus”
Reviews.Author: cook0005
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business. Friendly welcome and a good sized room is always a good start. Breakfast was good too. Daylight revealed what my map-reading hadn't, the significant distance to any of the tourist traps. However, the hotel provides a free shuttle bus which I took to St. Peter's, well worth the early departure time although they run several throughout the day. I am told that in the summer, the bus fills up quickly, although there were only 4 other passengers on the day I went. The lobby bar is lives up to its name, it is a bar in a lobby which makes for zero atmosphere. However, the service is good and the coffee excellent. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to travel, although transport links are regular”
Reviews.Author: LosTigres
Reviews.Content: We stay in the Melia whenever possible to utilise the point scheme run by the company, this stay was free with Melia mas points, that was a real plus. Trip advisor reviews posted left us quite sure what we were in for. It was out of the way- however the public bus was frequent & the hotel conicerge was very helpful & explained the most direct way to travel was bus then metro. Best advice- buy a 3 day ROMA pass from arrivals at Fuimicino airport. It paid for all public travel free, entry to 2 attractions, discounted also, all for 18E. The hotel bus was free & convienient but seats where not guarenteed, this was quite a problem when returning on the evening bus at 9.30. Mas panic was experienced, it was unpleasant being crushed and my 9 year old found it very traumatic. The 11pm bus was better, however be prepared to pay 20E for a cab if you dont get on. The hotel breakfast food was great value a two for one deal was on & my son was free, so for 16E we ate well. The main restaraunt was very over priced, too elaborate menu & far too formal. We used it on the first night and it was a never again. It was an enjoyable stay, some aspects where great, typical of a Melia hotel ie. service levels but other aspects disapointed me.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly, New, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: saycheese1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July 2006. I found it by accident by doing a GOOGLE search of hotels in Rome. I thought to treat myself to a little luxury travelling, so I chose this hotel based on a google link and the photos on the hotel website. Wow, it was right on! This hotel is definitely luxury. The staff treated me like I was a queen, the room was immaculate, the bed was large, minibar well stocked. Swimming pool and bar outside in the courtyard was a nice treat. Very clean hotel. The staff may not speak English fluently, but they try. It helps to know a little Italian, after all it is ITALY!!! I did find a concierge who spoke fluent French, so I had no problems communicating. (I speak English, French, and stumble along in Italian). The hotel is a little out of the way, but it is worth it. I enjoyed myself very much, so much that I joined the Sol Melia fidelity program and now I am staying at Sol Melia and Tryp Hotels all over Europe and earning points.... I am on my way to Paris this weekend and staying at Tryp François.....can't wait!!! Great hotel, great value!!!! Will definitely stay there again! Also a free shuttle bus to the airport, but at scheduled times so be aware of the schedule when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: Nursing
Reviews.Content: The Melia Antica is a very good business hotel. It is very clean and has large conference facilities and rooms. I would not recommend it for vacation travel. The hotel is far from downtown Rome or other attractions. There is a free shuttle bus to Rome that is very appreciated but it only goes and returns a few times a day. Also there are no other restos within walking distance of the Mélia so you are vitually obliged to eat at the hotel if you do not stay in Rome or have a car. The prices and the quality of the service at the restaurant are disappointing (16 euros for breakfast and more than 100 euros for a regular supper for two). We had an early morning checkout (0700) and there was only one staff person on the desk to handle individual travellers like us and the tour groups that often leave early. This was poor planning on the hotel's part and nearly caused us to be late for our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Distant Four Star”
Reviews.Author: Veryseasonedtraveler
Reviews.Content: Was a very good 4 star hotel with all the amenities. Biggest fault was location. It is isolated..... They have a shuttle, which takes you either to the Vatican area, or central Rome a few times a day. The return trip was always difficult. The city bus was quite an experience and taxis were expensive. Don't think the stay was worth the hastle in inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: dodgyb2001
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, worth the 4 stars it has for quality, but it is about 30 mins by bus from the centre of Rome. They do put on a courtesy bus for free, though it does get too busy in the peak summer, when we went in october it was fairly empty. The bus goes into rome about 7 times a day (picking up returnees at the same drop off point) With this you have to plan your day in Rome, but we found the best thing to do was go in at 8 am to the Vatican or 9:15 to the Piazza Vincenza (both really good locations for sight-seeing), then come home at 4:15 or 6 pm, and return at 9 for dinner, and then got picked back up at 11pm, so it worked out fairly well if you timed yourself. It usually takes a flat fee (set by Rome's council) of 40 euros to get there by taxi from the airport, but our taxi driver back to the airport charged us just 32. The courtesy bus avoids the hazards of public transport in Rome, which is rife with pickpockets (my fiance's aunt and friends reported being pickpocketed on the bus to the vatican city in separate incidents) so it might seem a problem being so far out, it's actually very useful utilizing the bus. The weather in Rome at that time of year was just turning to the wet and colder side, though for most of our week there it was warm and dry. This means the pool is closed after September, which I was disappointed by, so I would recommend going in September to get weather which is moderately warm and quieter buses. The staff were friendly and helpful, and able to speak English fairly well. The room was clean and spaceous, with air-conditioning, and a fridge/mini-bar which we stocked with our own drinks/food. There was also a TV with 25 channels including english CNN, french and MTV Europe. We got the hotel at a very cheap rate for a 4 star, and both had a pleasure staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room, Inconvenient Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: AverageAmerican
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Roma Hotel in October 2006. The room we were assigned was intended for handicapped accessibility (only king size, no smoking room available). The room was very nice and quite large with a large marble tiled bath. The room had large windows but very poor lighting in the bedroom area. We also noted that our room had no clock or alarm. The breakfast selection was quite good with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, vegetables, assorted meats and cheeses, assorted rolls, juices, fruit, yogurt and cereals. However, the scrambled eggs were very runny and the bacon, although tasty, was undercooked as well. I had to really pick through the bacon to find some that was the least bit crispy. The bacon and eggs were also just on the lukewarm side and not really hot. The hotel runs a shuttle bus into Rome but the shuttle schedule is not very convenient. We found that the shuttle ride into Rome in the morning took about an hour to get to the drop off location. Please note that the drop off is no longer in front of the Bernini hotel as noted in other reviews. The route has been changed and the drop off location is now just behind the Victor Emmanual Monument in the Capitol Hill Area. While I don't recall all the shuttle times, I do recall that there is an 8:00 AM shuttle to the Vatican Area and a 9:30 AM shuttle to the Capitol Hill area. Coming home in the evening there is a 6:15, 9:30 and 11:00 shuttle from the Capitol Hill drop spot. The shuttles busses are large coach busses which hold about 54 passengers. On our first night there, the 9:30 shuttle had more riders than seats. Because they will not allow people to stand on the bus, several people were unable to get on the shuttle and had to take a taxi back to the hotel (they didn't want to wait for the 11:00 shuttle). I'm not sure what the taxi ride would have cost but I would guess it would be in the 20-30 euro range because the hotel is quite a distance from the Rome city center. Rome is a busy and noisy city and bustling with tourists and pickpockets. So I enjoyed staying out of town a bit where it was more quiet and we felt more secure. Although the shuttle service was a nice benefit I must say that the shuttle time schedule was not very convenient. The shuttle ride could take anywhere from 30 to 60 minutes and there were large gaps in the shuttle pick up and drop off times. Therefore going back to the hotel in the afternoon for a break was not really an option because of the few shuttle times available and the length of the shuttle ride. Also, 6:15 PM was earlier than we wanted to leave Rome and 9:30 PM was later. Somewhere in the 8:00 or 8:30 PM range would have been nice but was not available. Also worth mentioning is that the taxi ride to the FCO airport costs about 40 euros.

Reviews.Title: “For convenience to airport only...”
Reviews.Author: met716
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a night before heading back home and chose it for the convenience to Fiumicino as we were leaving early the next morning. This hotel looked popular with tour groups. Although our room was quite nice and spacious with a large/clean bathroom, I would not recommend this hotel to others who are looking to sightsee in Rome due to it's location on the outskirts of the city and lack of anything else around the hotel. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant as there are no other options around and found the meal to be below average especially relative to the price. We got the feeling that the hotel knows the guests are a relatively captive audience and uses this to their advantage. The service in the hotel was fine for the most part with the exception of the not so friendly or helpful concierge who checked us in and then told us it would be impossible to organize a simple boxed breakfast for the next morning as we were leaving before breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel on the outskrts of rome”
Reviews.Author: trinity-tiger
Reviews.Content: this hotel was part of my insight amazing italy tour this hotel is very nice and modern, but there is not much around it and is away from the center of rome - when i woke up from my nap on my first day, there was no where to go ouside the hotel for a walk until we were to met our tour director the included breakfast buffet was wonderful has internet service available in the lobby for a nominal fee (5 euros) for 30 minutes the hotel gift shop closes in mid afternoon - i did not know this so i was unable to purchase a calling card to call my parents until just before we left for our evening excursion - was unable to call until after 10 pm at night - there is a seven hour time difference between rome and san antonio and when we arrived at the hotel at 10:30 in the morning, it was 3:30 in the morning back home i would definitely choose a hotel in the center of rome i am from san antonio, texas

Reviews.Title: “Too far off the beaten path for us”
Reviews.Author: bwelman
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Staying out of town was just too inconvenient for us. There are no alternative restaurants around or anything you can walk to. You are solely dependent on the hotel shuttle bus and thus glued to their schedule. It would be so much more efficient to be staying in town and that would give you so much more flexibility. During the annual La Nortte Bianca festival the entire town went to gridlock. No bus or taxi service for the entire night from about 7PM. The hotel did post the bus schedule on the bulletin board saying there would be no pickup at 9:30 and 11:30. But we missed that and spent the night on the street. Would have been nice if they would have posted it on the bus. We were not the only ones however , people from other hotels were waiting in vain as well. I guess that was part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: r00nsky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect in every way. We arrived at this site and then followed the link through hotels.com and got a fantastic deal compared with what we would have paid through their own website. Apart from our nightmare journey to the hotel on the first night everything was fine. NOTE.. if you are arriving on the late Ryanair flight into Ciampino Airport (11.35pm), you need to note the following information. We booked our bus trip into Rome city centre through Terrovision (they sell tickets for the transfers on Ryanair), they dropped us all off at a spot a couple of minutes from Termini train station and then left us all there. Most people obviously knew where they were going and soon left. it was quite deserted apart from a few people hanging around. We needed to find a taxi as this hotel is a way out and the shuttle bus stops at 11.00pm. I was annoyed with Terrovision the way they just left everyone, they should have at least left us in a place where there was a taxi rank. After much walking around the train station with no taxi rank in sight, we exhaustedly accepted a taxi ride from an un-licensed taxi cab, this was a last resort as we were tired and didn't know where we were. We did agree a price before we got in, don't pay more that 30 euros. We paid 30 although the hotel aferwards said it should have 25. We got in this car which was so, so small that we were cramped up with luggage and it was really uncomfortable. The first problem was, the driver did not know where the hotel was, didn't know the area and had to phone the hotel for directions umpteen times. We were driven all over the place, he kept stopping and asking for directions and then kept driving everyhwre, it was a nightmare journey in this cramped excuse for a car. After an hour and a half of driving around and many calls to the hotel, he found it and we got out. fair enough he was apologetic enough and didn't try and rip us off on the agreed price but it was an awful start to our journey. The flight is late enough without having another long journey driving around the back streets of Rome. Word of warning DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE AS WE DID. The hotel can arrange for a taxi to collect you from Termini if you call the hotel when you get on the bus at the airpot they will send a proper taxi to meet you off. If only we know this beforehand however the benefit of our experience may help others. the bus journey from Ciampino to Rome centre takes 30 minutes the drive to the hotel from the centre only takes about 22 minutes. The taxi should cost you no more than 25 Euro's. if you arrive earlier of course you can use the hotel free shuttle bus which is excellent. The hotel is luxurious the staff are lovely so helpful and speak good English. The shuttle bus is great and takes you either to Rome centre or the Vatican. they give you a timetable when you arrive a the hotel. It is always on time too. We never experienced any overcrowding but we got the later buses in after having an early morning swim and stayed until late. There is a nice little gift shop in the hotel and the man who works there is a like a tourist guide himself. He will tell you all the places to visit which the book dosen't. the rooms are spacious and clean. the hotel is quite expensive be warned. The mini bar is 4 euros for a sof drink and 8 euros for spirits as is the main bar bay the pool. 11 euros for a gin and tonic and although the measures are huge, it is quite pricey. If you want an alcoholic drink at the poolside bar, choose a glass of wine at 4 euros. The outside bar is open until midnight and they nice piano music overlooking the lit up gardens and pool. The pool is huge and clean, there is a life guard. The staff are nice and helpful and the surroundings beautiful, it is lovely and quiet and relaxing after a long day in Rome and the shuttle bus is the perfect way to enjoy this hotel which is a way out. We had dinner on the last night which is pricey too, but added touches like complimentary glass of sparking wine and a little caviar dish, nice biscuits at the end makes up for it. The meal cost us 85 euros, but that included a bottle of red wine, 2 coffees, 2 deserts and 2 main courses, so roughly 30 Pounds each for a really nice dinner with wine and dessert. All in all we loved this hotel, nice bathroom toileteries, complimentary sweets at the bedside in the room, lots of little touches which made it special.

Reviews.Title: “quiet business like hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottswatches
Reviews.Content: We went on honeymoon there, but i think it would suit the business customer more. Not that we weren't happy, but the service was a bit impersonal and almost german like efficent - not very italian at all!. The rooms were good, very quiet and clean. Facilities all worked, breakfast was great and we had dinner at the hotel once which was really enjoyable. Don't walk into town - it's way too long along tight, dark roads with roman drivers. Take the frequent shuttle bus and it's no problem. Opt for the breakfast at the hotel, as there are no cafes close by If you want somewhere to relax after a lot of sightseeing, then the hotel is great. If you want somewhere to remember or knock you out with features/design/character, please consider somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Melia Roma Aurelia Antica Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Degli Aldobrandeschi 223, 00163 Rome, Italy
